name: Aluratek Fast Charge Black Power Bank with Dual USB and Single USB-C Ports 20000mAh
review: Works great. Stays charged for a long time. Charges fast.

name: Angry Birds: Star Wars - Xbox One
review: I'm 60years old and watched my grandson of age 6 play on his tablet. we loved taking turns. I wanted to be able to play my own as a player #2... went to look for this game as it was a 2 player up to a 4 player. gam estop made it easy by looking and finding is wasn't in their store. ordered and it in came and in time for Christmas.. we play and I able able to enjoy this game Angry Birds Star Wars with ease.We bought this game to play with our adult children. It was easy to learn and fun for all to play. Four player games are getting to be so rare now days and this was perfect.This game should have been ended a long time ago, on the mobile devices of course, but yet they decide to keep it alive. This game should not be bought for it is just a higher price than the mobile device prices. A full review of this game is not needed because this game fails to deliver any real and new content. Other than the "new" levels they made there is no new content.This Game Sucks. It is Angry Birds on the Xbox. It does NOT work plus Angry Birds is outdated and should be put to restIt you played angry birds you will like this game, it is for everyone to play becasue it is a casual game.

name: Atari Flashback Classics Vol 3 - PlayStation 4
review: Like these old games but they should have been put on 1 disk instead of 3. Not a lot of data required for 8 bit games. They only did it to make more money. Rob the consumer???Do not let the 3 stars on graphics mislead you.  For anyone who has nostalgia for playing the Atari 2600 and Atari Arcade games, any of the volumes of this series is a must.  AGAIN: For those who love the classic games!  Anyone who was raised on 1080p graphics, 3d modeled action games may not enjoy this as much, so take this under consideration, as they may be disappointed.  For all those who love the classic games from the 70's, this is the games we love and missed.  Excellent for introducing a gaming newbie to the gaming world while reliving the games of old.the flashback classic took me back to my childhood,the games are just as i remember them,the grahics are terrible if want to compare them to today's  video game, but still funI grew up playing the Atari 2600 and its various games. So I was thrilled to stumble onto volum three with the 5200 system!! Thanks so much for the games folks!!Like I played Atari 5200 system for games. The games are classic.

name: Barbie Groom and Glam Pups - Nintendo DS
review: I got this game when I was younger and it was a lot of fun. Thank You for a game that made me very happy!When it comes time to name your animal ot doesn't work properly. I was 10 when I got it and I thought it would be fun and have more to do with the dogs and teaching them tricks. But it's mainly about Barbie and her dog. For little kids it would be fun, but there's barely any choices to choose your own dog. Like I said, okay for little little kids who like Barbie.THIS IS THE BEST GAME EVER MADE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! PS. HARDCORE GAMERS GET THIS GAME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Batman: Arkham Asylum and Batman: Arkham City Dual Pack - Xbox 360
review: The graphics are pretty good...game is a little hard...but the batman costume is really lt...and the skills are good.I bought this last week because I had the third one and needed the first two. I was not disappointed when I bought them however I have the policy about the scratches and the first one Arkham asylum is scratched and at a certain point it stops working so yea. But nonetheless still great games!!I bought this bundle not knowing that it came with all of he dlc and to my surprise it came with it! They arr two of the best games of the last generation and they both won game of the year in their years respectivly.

name: Battlefield 1
review: Game is great historical ww1 shooter. A lot of free dlc was given to the players and the game has great gamplay and beautiful graphics.It is not a good game..................................................................THE BEST BATTLEFIELD EVER AND WANTED TO GET IT FOR MY PC AND WANTED TO PLAY IT SO BADI'm mainly writing this to help the games review on Gamestop... But it doesn't deserve a 3.7 that it's listed at. If you like shooters, and HUGE maps, lots of sniping space, vehicles, 40 players and great graphics.. Stop wasting time and start downloading this game. My only downside to it really is the download size... It's enormous ~50GB.This game is probably one of the most realistic FPS I've played. The game play is amazing, not to mention a history lesson. The game is intense. When you put a good gaming headset on you can hear the bullets wizzing by, its pretty crazy. Online play is intense and fast paced, the multipul arrays of vehicle choices and different weapons make for a game that keeps on giving.Battlefield has strayed from what made it great, and is now turning into the pile of garbage known as Call of Duty. If you want a good WW1 game get Verdun. It's cheaper and actually realistic. Absolutely 0 lasting appeal. No desire to play this at all.The overall concept of the game is good; I do like how the game comes with new features like the bayonet charge. I also like the options of a vehicle having the capability of holding a lot of people. What I do not like is the game is full of glitches. This is not a well-polished game at all. It leaves a lot to be desired. If you have a FPS that you already like and know this may not be a good choice for you. The vehicles being able to carry multiple passengers are the only good feature about them. The viewing angles are awful and while this might be historically correct is does not make for good game play. Shotguns are ridiculously over powered! People one shot from halfway across the map as well as handgun sniping seems to be happening too. I don’t know if this a cheating issue or a skill issue. The last point I would make is that all the servers have very low Tic counts. This can make for some very short games. More load time then actual play time. I would only recommend this game if you are looking for a game that takes place during this time period or you would want a FPS while not having one that is current.With the game barely coming out it is in fair quality, the game has amazing rendering, graphics, and sound environments. The games campaign is quite an experience with action packed scenes and thought out storyline. The playstyle is similar to bf3 and 4 but has some really outstanding additions to the game. The only bad part that is standing because it was just released... The multiplayer is not balanced, I feel as though the game gives you the WORST weapons to start off with; It's understandable to give beginners OK weapons but the ones you receive are absolute garbage. Also at the moment some of the aiming for non single fire/ Bolt action is slightly off, missing shots when you know you hit them. (It is not any connection problems or game lag that is affecting my biased opinion as I have an amazing computer and 45 or so Ping.)

name: Big Rumble Boxing: Creed Champions  - Xbox One
review: The game is fun, but would be better with online VS mode. This game is not Fight Night and if that is what your looking for this game is not for you. The game is fun for a little trash talk between friends. I've unlocked almost every character so I'll be trading it end soon.

name: Bioworld Merchandising Batman Bifold Wallet
review: It’s a nice wallet I picked it because Batman is a great superhero he’s my favorite superhero fits a lot of credit cards

name: Borderlands 2
review:
Gearbox removed LAN feature without even a logical reason. This game used to be amazing, but now it's garbage.  Will not change review until they add LAN back. No logical reason for removing it.  And before anyone comments about playing online, bad internet where I live, and me and my friends used to play LAN, now it just sits uninstalled in my steam library.Bought this game awhile ago as a few of my friends have it, and it looked like it would be a fun thing to play. It is, and I am glad I bought it. Very easy to play, and as such, very addictive.Bought this game when it first came out in 2012, lost it somehow, and bought it again as a download.
Best yuk-yuk arcade style shoot-em-up game ever!! Stands the test of time!  Can't wait fo Borderlands 3.This game is hard to describe. And that is in the good way. This game has it all. Procedurally generated loot, awesome weapons, more dlc than any other game I know, hilarious characters (like a certain CL4P-TP unit) and engaging story, amazing open world size (beat only by -insert bethesda game here-), and so much customization. This is only scratching the surface of Borderlands 2's amazingnesseses.I enjoy this game to many extents. It appeals to my hardcore gamer side, as well as my need for comedic effect in certain instances. I love the multitude of references, as well as the core gameplay mechanics. It definitely lives up to the first one's reputation.Borderlands 1 trumps this game in almost every important aspect.
The guns in B1 look much better. In B2 they all look really weird that you would think they're all alien guns.
In B1 you like the bad guys(especially General Knoxx), in B2 you are annoyed by them as they tell unfunny jokes and crude humor.
There are also some mean things that they do to old characters in B2 that I really hate. I can not tell to you here, you must google it.
The atmosphere is drenched with depression every step of the way, that it sucks.
Also they limited you to 27 items backpack. Yes, a huge downgrade from B1.
Gearbox made some lame excuses about why it is that way, but you can tell the writer does not even believe what the he was writing.
It's such a disappointment, much more so because of so much work put into it(good environs, mini bosses), ruined at the core by flawed ideas.PhysX physics engine really shines in this game. People playing this game on XBox 360 or PS3 dont know what there missing. Dynamic particles are everywhere! Really helps to have a second video card just dedicated to running PhysX. Running 560 Ti as main graphics card and 550Ti as dedicated PhysX card.This game is alot of fun to play, there are thousands of guns that do all sorts of things from shooting fireballs to guns that explode when thrown. The person who said this game is easy was most likely playing this on easy and then complained its way to easy. Sure its not the hardest game in the world but i wouldnt say its "Easy". This game has alot to offer for this who are sick of generic fps games such as COD or Battlefield. Only reason i didnt give it a ten is because i think the sound of the guns could have been much better but thats just my opinion.This game is a terrific game. It is so fun and addicting I play it all the time. It is great for casual and hardcore gamers. I seriously recommend this game to anyone who is considering about buying it.Hey guys, just wanted to shed some light on pc version and console version as I own both. If you have a pc that can run it then get it for pc you'll love all the added Physx stuff that goes along with it and having native 1080p support where as the console has 720p then upconverted and no AA applied. The game for all 3 systems is solid and very fun. More story this time around. Graphics are good but if your a PC gamer and play this game on console for example I originally purchased for Xbox and edges of the game are really jagged and some of the graphics are meh. On PC you can apply AA or FXAA and it'll get rid of the jagged edges and the graphics are bumped up. Also the game supports physx so you got some extra goodies with the game if your card support it. Well thats just my 2 cents, happy gaming.This is an amazing game already have beat it with two characters and still am find new things. If you you thought it was too easy then you aren't playing the missions at the correct level.WAY BETTER THEN BORDERLANDS 1. You gotta get it if you loved borderlands1, the story is amazing with a lot of funny parts spread around the gameall i can say is amazing...... cant stop playing the game has consumed my life. The moment i bought it i couldnt get off.First of all, why are you reading this? You should have bought this game ages ago!!! IT'S BORDERLANDS 2! This game is the best co-op experience you can buy. So much fun to play with your friends. The dialog is the funniest stuff I've ever heard. And this games has 87 BAZILLION GUNS! They even got an award for most guns in a video game, yeah, A FREAKING AWARD. Now go to gamestop right now, and THROW ALL YOUR MONEY AT THE REGISTER AND BUY THIS GAME! STOP READING THIS ALREADY AND GOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Its a fun game but i didnt feel like it was hard at all. I laugh at people that play this game. Go play a real game that actually takes skill.

name: Brothers in Arms: Earned in Blood
review: I like the game alot but i cant play online because i downloaded it from ebgames.com so i dont have a cd key so i cant play online. But the game is challenging, it gives you a feeling of how intense WW 2 was, and you get an incredibly sweet feeling when you falnk the enemy and finish them. The story is awsome because it shows it from another perspective. It tells you alot about your charecter. Joe Hartsock or "Red" is a careing squad leader who would do anything just to get his men home in one piece. But he realizes that he cant save anyone so he thinks he's there to shorten the casualties. You have to take your men are part of the legendary 101st Airborne. You'll need tactical excellence to get through this game. But you also need to care for your men because you will need them to help you and if they die you have no chance so keep them alive!

name: Cabela's The Hunt Tournament Edition  - Nintendo Switch
review: I bought this game but it was the same as the old one. Nobody at the store can figure out what's going on. Was the game not released this year  or is it a remake?

name: Collective Minds Switch Up Game Enhancer for Nintendo Switch
review: This device claims that it will allow you to connect a xbox one controller to your switch.  You cannot connect through bluetooth with this device.  You have to connect a bluetooth xbox adapter to the device.  There are other devices available that will allow you to connect without an additional adapter.  Not Gamestops fault, the manufacturer is misleading people on the packaging.Takes the grindy aspect out of gathering and hatching eggs in Pokemon Sword/Shield. I would recommend it if you are impatient and don't enjoy the grindy nature of shiny hunting (like me). I think there's a version coming out that will additionally support Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl, so you may want to hold off and wait for that one, but idk the full details. Can't say much about other games or it's ability to connect to anything but a switch pro controller because I haven't cared to try yet.It’s great for me, seeing I could use a ps4 controller on my switchRead some great reviews and purchased this for a Christmas gift. GameStop has always provided great products and services in the past so expect the same with this purchase.It’s perfect for Pokémon shiny hunting, but Nintendo has since made the watt grinding impossible, so don’t buy it for watts, I’ve gotten 9-11 shinies in the span on a weekBought it for Pokémon Shield and works as intended. Online guides are extremely helpful.The muscle memory of other controllers can be used on the switch.Needs a prefab manuel for cheat activation and you can only connect 1 kind of other console controller at a time. Tried using 2 ps4 controlers to no avail.It has helped a lot since I don't regularly use the switch controllers.Works amazing but a little confusing on directions

name: Create-a-Space Storage Center 10 Piece Set
review: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We used this product to consolidate and make my sons craft supplies more accessible. Pleased to report that now he's drawing, coloring and painting much more often![This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was ver disappointed that this purchase never happened[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these for my two grandsons and they got new desks, so I thought the create a space storage center would work out for them!![This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I can not give this enough stars! It holds all my kids coloring supplies with room for more! I love that i can grab just one section at a time when I dont want thwm using certain things (aka markers) lol[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use the Create-a-Space Storage Center to organize my art tools close to my drawing/drafting table. It keeps my items neatly grouped, close-at-hand, and adds colorful accents to my workspace![This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We use it every day for our daughter to help her with her homework/ extra school time and everything is in one place now, we absolutely love it[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We had pencils, markers, glue sticks, you name it scattered in random totes and cups all over, and it was difficult to keep track of it all when we needed to use it. The Create-a-Space Storage Center has really helped us to organize things and make it more accessible for our kids to use. Taking out the section that you need comes in handy when working on project especially with all the at home learning. If you are in need of organizing this will definitely help you accomplish that and if you're on the fence I would suggest purchasing this![This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice high walls mean things don't spill out, and it stays nice and organized enough to live on our kitchen table, which is home base for the twins' remote kindergarten work.I use this on my "craft center" right by the kitchen table, which ends up being the "craft" table as well. Very helpful for easy grabbing and quick clean up for a four year old. I like the lightness of the containers and the colors are fun. They are low profile, which makes it difficult for markers or pens to stand up in. It would be great to have different heights, with some sort of Sliced effect to have the tall containers in the back. Overall, does it's job effectively, organizes, quick to get supplies and quick to clean up. Happy with it!I have 3 of this wonderful storage caddies and I plan on getting more! These are absolutely awesome! They save me so much time in my preschool classroom! I have all kinds of markers and stamping markers in one, all my bingo daubers in another, and paint sticks in the 3rd one. Boom! Just set them on the table and you're done! No more getting things together! Love, love, love them!!!Perfect for my speech room. I love that I can take out little sections when needed and then put them all back at the end of the day.Sturdy, colorful, spacious, multiple potential uses.These are perfect for my daughters' desks in our homeschool room. They are a great size & are already helping to keep daily supplies near-at-hand and organized.The storage center is so useful for crafters! One can easily organize their craft tools and remove one bin at a time depending on the tools they need. I do wish the base was a turn-table, however, it is nice that small openings are notched in the bottom of the tray to allow for picking up and moving. I love it and wish I had more!This is a great product to store materials or use with centers. I love the fact that the the containers are removable. The colors are bright and students enjoy using this storage center. I have used it in a a variety of ways, including storing materials for a writing center, as well as a math center. I would recommend this product to any educator who is looking for an organizational storage space.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used this product in two ways. At first I just used it to store writing utensils at my small group table. Then I decided to use it as a 'Centers materials' organizer. Since each bin is removable, the student is able to take the bin to his/her desk.This little organization system is great for children. The fact that each section is removable is very helpful. We love it![This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These organization pockets help me to keep important classroom items in a place where I can easily locate them. I always know where my dry erase markers are! Until I received these, I would spend minutes at a time trying to find them. Now I have a designated place for them. I'm thrilled and so are my students! We have been using them for Exit Slips and storage areas for some classroom center materials! They are so well-made and colorful! I would highly recommend them for a teacher who is looking for a way to keep items organized!Got this to use during center time in the center of 48" round table. I love the size; it could sit in the center of the table and not intrude into student's work space. Can put pencil in center but found outer buckets could hold pencils just as well. This allowed me to make the center cup for my supplies and outer buckets for students supplies. It is sturdy and well made, both students and teacher could rotate it without any trouble. Held general items needed at the table without spilling or tipping over. Small bins can be removed as needed but rooted so easily never needed to remove. Could easily assign individual buckets to students. We did drop it on the tile floor once and none of the plastic cracked or broke. I am planning on purchasing two more for my other two tables.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product as part of an incentivized review program. I cannot explain how much I LOVE this storage center! I am currently using the storage center as part of my writing center in my kindergarten classroom! This organizational space is compromised of 8 smaller containers on a circular tray. The containers are the perfect size for crayons, scissors, erasers, markers, and glue sticks. I love how the smaller containers on the "lazy susan" stand are removable. Students can take a smaller container out if needed. The students love using this at their writing station and makes clean up a breeze. My once messy writing station is now perfectly organized! I would recommend this product to any classroom teacher regardless of age to help with organizing the classroom.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have used my storage center on my guided reading table. Since I got my storage center, I have received positive comments from both staff and students. The vivid colors match my students' desk organizers. I would definitely recommend this tool to school staff to keep their desk or centers more organized.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product has cleaned up my desk and closet. I was able to organize items that the kids don't keep on their tables so they constantly need my help getting. With this the items like scissors glue makers colored pencils post it's high lighters are all out and visible and if one table needs a particular item they are able to get to it quick and easy.

name: DOOM - Nintendo Switch
review:
You guys sent me a European Game. I meanit works fine and everything it's still in english and the Switch is region free but don't you guys not take foreign games?The game translates great to the Nintendo switch lite platform.Fast paced game,  I love itThis was a really cool & solid game. Pretty difficult at sometimes but overall good.Game came with the original Case. Very good condition on pre-owner.Great game play, story line!! My switch handles the graphics well. Love this game!WHY NO CO-OP CAMPAIGN???

Co-op campaign with your best friend and his kid is like going on vacation!

Please include it in the next incarnation.It’s an innovative FPS because playing defensively will kill you. You need to plow forward for life and ammo. It’s repetitive, but in a good way... kinda like playing a bunch of Tetris.Non stop action, blasting my way through the game. Huge guns , big bosses good story. Visuals are great. A lot of cameos in the game.
Well worth the money. It’s a must add to the collectionFun game, was challenging though for my girlfriend who’s not a hardcore gamer, she gave up on final boss.Always a great game to play. Took some getting used to playing it on the Switch, but is still TONS of fun.Super fun, intense, run & gun reboot of an already great game.It was a lot of fun and a great introduction to the Nintendo switch.Its brutal, I love it and it's easy as all heavens above to play it on switch.Fantastic game filled with lots of action and tons of nods to the original series of gamesGreat quality game so far. The graphics are top notch. Worth the price definitely.This is a must have on Switch, just have some extra space available for the multiplayer update! It looks and runs beautifully, and I’m even enjoying the online matches!Love how I can play Doom on the go despite the loss in quality when compared to Xbox or PS4.Excelente game. A bit disappointed on the port, still fluent though. The game itself is superb.I have been playing the doom series since 93 when it came out on pc I was 3 at that time slaying demons on my dads lap and I have to say it never disappoints (except for the movie adaptations -_-)Its amazing what doom accomplished on the go. Granted it wasn't the best game graphically but I have doom in the palm of my hands now. Something the PS4, Xbox and the PS Vita could never do.Good game, not for those that like to feel invincible. You will die.Great action game with plenty of difficulty to keep you on your toesEvery so often, there comes a time when I want to just sit back and play an FPS that's actually challenging. Doom is the game I was looking for. It's the perfect game to play if you want to take your mind off things or just pass the time. I never felt exessively frustrated when I died because it always felt like my fault as the player, rather than the game's fault. And that is exactly how it ought to be. Just don't play it on ultra-nightmare unless you're some kind of masochist. I rate it five out of five in graphics, gameplay, and lasting appeal.Fun game but it’s  really a stretch to call this one Doom. I had to set the difficulty to low and mess with the motion settings to be able to play. Still a must have shooter for the switch as there aren’t much out there at all.Controls are difficult and the graphics aren’t nearly worth it.I know it’s a good game but your telling me it’s 14ish$ on the PS4 but to have it on the go it’s 40 extra dollars?!Great game converted to the Nintendo Switch. Over all a great game.The game is very awesome love the graphics and the music is hardcore very cool. Better than the computer versionThis game is incredible. Not really my thing normally, but glad to have it as a part of my collection.  Would not have bought digital.The Action was on point every hit, shot and kill felt intense. The music was noteworthy and believe the game strays away from average triple A games and marks it self as one of those good callbacksAside from the controversial multiplayer that is a mix of Halo and Call of Duty with the loadouts, which is new to the Doom series (Yes I am old school purist when it comes to the old school Doom multiplayer) but while it is quite convenient to just have DOOM on your switch on the go, the game does have to suffer a bit in the technical department so You won't get those sweet 60 frames per second which is crucial because you got alot of demons to kill and you can't have less than 60 due to all the things go on.   Also, same as the other xbox, ps4 and pc platforms, the game play is too restricting in my opinion.  also, there is no snapmap mode so you can forget about creating maps.   and lastly, the multiplayer is, again just a mix of Halo and Cod, riddled with loadouts because it's too difficult for millennial to actually find weapons on the map and the demon runes are truly unnecessary and all it is just a crutch to help a losing team win.   back in the old school days, all you had on you was a pistol and 50 rounds for it, so you'd either find weapons, armor and whatnot or else you were a dead man.  other than all that, it's an okay game on the switch.This game is almost too fun. But it was a bit too gory to have around my kids so I returned it and got Zelda BOTW and SMK8. If you're into fast-paced, intense shooters then this won't disappoint!!! I can't really rate how a major gamer would see this one, but for what it's worth it was one of the best games I've ever played for what my expectations were before I bought it. I think maybe someday I'd like to buy it again, but for now it was a bit much. I'm not a huge video game player and you would need to immerse yourself in it to get the full experience. I've just got too much adulting to deal with. I can't knock the game for anything. I would highly recommend it.THE best FPS on the switch. I have not stop playing this game since I got it. Love the story mode AND the multiplayer. SO Fun and fast paced!Great homage to the original DOOM. Plays very well on the Switch.I had purchased this game because I have it for the PS4, so I was more less expecting the same idea but I pretty much got the same package. I praise the switch's gimmick, the ability to move your switch around and play in a somewhat VR-like experience with 360 fps.

However, the big point that sent me running for the hills was the myltiplayer, its current status is practically dead, no pun intended and not good in anyway. Whenever i would jump into online/multiplayer, i would spend about an hour or so just waiting, maybe getting lucky with a match.  The only way I could play online for sure is if I get invited or invite someone to my party, but unless you have many friends with the game don't expect too much out of the multiplayer aspect. Unfortunately, this was a big driving point & reason I had to return the game. I did not want to rate the game one star for this reason however, as I fear that would be unjust and unfair to the game as a whole.

Extremely happy with my purchase!I hate Bethesda's business and legal practices with a fiery passion, but there's no getting around how honest this game is. When I played Doom as a kid, this sort of action is exactly what my imagination conjured. It plays *extremely* well on the Switch. Graphics are also incredible, and FPS drops are basically nonexistent. Good work, Id and Bethsoft.Excellent game. Offline bots. Single player and multiplayer. Fun and looks goodAwesome, full of gore, would definitely recommend this game to everyone.It doom, you buy this to play a run and gun with chainsaws and BFG 
What that not what you want then don’t buy itI bought the game around two and a half weeks ago, it worked well for a week and now just won't start up. The case they gave me came without a cover picture and only an ugly game stop one, so it was an eyesore in my shelf. But it's a good game, couldn't finish it though because, you know.The Campaign is great, Multiplayer is pretty dead by now, but fun.If you’re into first person shooters this is an excellent game to get.This is, without a doubt, the best shooter I have ever played, second only to the original Doom, where it all began (quite literally). Id and Bethesda came together to create, not a game, but an experience, that could hold a legitimate claim to the Doom throne, and what they came out with was overqualified. DOOM (or New Doom, as I like to call it) is everything anyone can, has, and ever will love about the First Person Shooter genre and so much more. It does what Doom always has, it innovates and improves upon the genre as a whole, taking the best of it all and leaving out the worst. New Doom is a remaster, reboot, and sequel all in one nifty, stress-inducing, tense, hair-raising, hellraising, action-packed journey through an unending wave of death. While Doom is not known for its story-telling (except for the film (eugh) and Doom 3), New Doom has a story, but it doesn't foist it upon you every few minutes and then gives you very little action, like most other shooters. It keeps the story to a minimum and cranks the nonstop action to an astounding 150%, and that's just after the first few chapters. It ups the ante as the game goes on, getting more and more intense. It's unrelenting, and that's Doom at its finest, as it always has been. Even the bosses don't relent, and even though they are few, they make it feel like you're going up against multiple bosses at once. The weapons are gorgeous. I got so turned on by the Gauss Can on and when I discovered the siege mode powerup, I absolutely lost it. It doesn't introduce many new weapons (in fact, the Gauss is actually the only new weapon), but it more than makes up for that by introducing weapon mods, which make it feel like you're using brand new weapons. Their abilities do use up considerable amount, but it makes up for that by dealing devestatingly massive damage to your enemies. And yes, the Chainsaw and the BFG are still there and, yes, they are as powerful as ever. The demons are so perfectly updated in their appearance. While they are a departure from the looks of the old demons, it's hard to mistake them for anything else other than what each individual demon is (for example, the Imp looks wildly different, but you still know it's an Imp just by the way it acts). There are only 2 new demons in the main story, but there is nothing wrong with that, because this is New Doom! You came from the 1993 masterpiece hoping to have a go at your old favorites as well as a few new contenders! And the game doesn't disappoint in the least bit. Besides, the game keeps you tense and on your toes so much, it doesn't matter. From the sounds of it, Eternal will have so many more new demons, which will more than make up for the lack of new demons here. New Doom is every bit of the shooter it makes itself out to be, and is more than deserving of being on the roster of the Doom series. If you're reading this, wondering if you should get in the game or not, I'd say you should absolutely get into it. Rip and tear... until it is done.My fiancé and I bought a nintendo switch and bought Doom for it. The graphic and gameplay are amazing. And excellent revamp to the old styles.DOOM (2016) is an excellent game, and it plays pretty well on the Nintendo Switch. It can feel a bit odd when playing the game in handheld mode, but this goes away after the first few hours. I recommend using the Pro Controller when playing. However, if you prefer graphics over gameplay, you might not find this port of DOOM to be enjoyable. I'm looking forward to purchasing DOOM: Eternal, this game's sequel, on Switch when it releases.If you are getting this game solely for campaign then skip this comment entirely because that part works splendidly and the load times are mind blowingly fast. What contains the issues is the multiplayer, not only are the servers so bad (it will sometimes take over 30 minutes to find a game) but the frame rate is so poor that it looks like you and the other person are lagging when it comes to fighting. I had high hopes for this (not as high as it was for the console of course) but it sadly and utterly let me down, the Switch did a good job of laying out the framework for Nintendo to have some AMAZING titles and collaborations in the future but this system was just not strong enough to do a game like this in multiplayer quite yet. So if you wanted this for multiplayer save yourself some time and money and wait on this, just stick to playing it on consolesThought it would be absolute trash, being that it was for a Nintendo console, and also that it was for the switch. Looking forward to Doom Eternal for the Switch!Coming from a PC that runs Doom at 1440p 144fps,I was surprised how well Doom runs on the switch. Must have for the Switch!! A+/10!!!It’s so much fun and replay is great! Shoot ‘me up demon fun!Doom is challenging yet fun to play, I love that it's not to dark east to see demons before they kill youGreat port of the new Doom. But the price is still a little high. Nintendo needs to address this.Yes, yes, yes! I'm a happy man. I can't recommend this game as it can make you sick.Doom is a great game, 9/10 for me, but  What makes this version so good is the switch. I have never played a better looking or better running shooter on a portable system. It’s nothing short of amazing.I am very satisfied by the gameplay of this. Having it on the go really makes it a great purchase for the Nintendo Switch. There's only a select few points where the the lags also. It takes boring nuances of shooters and disposes of them. No reloading animation, no place to hide for cover. You let it all out and have to Glory Kill to get health. As Mark Brown points out in his video about Doom, the game revolves around the glory kill mechanic, and it makes for huge fights where you have to dance around the area. Just great.I love this game.Straight to the point,shoot and destroy everything! !ANARCHYGreat game. Fast paced shooter with a really interesting story line if you choose to dive in to the data logs. Here's how they ruined it:
Leveling up. I'm trying to kill demons, not dragons. FOH with that Skyrim rpg garbage.
Mandatory internet connection. I bought this for my portable system. Why would I need to be connected to the internet to play campaign? You've literally made it unplayable for the majority of the customers. Oh, and if your connection drops, it boots you and loses progress.
Massive download. If you don't have an sd card and have some other games on the system you're gonna have to choose between them. 
No screenshots. Not a deal breaker, but a pretty stupid restriction. 

I'm hoping for an update that'll allow me to play offline, till then it's a docked-only gameThe multiplayer rocks. The campaign rocks. You can play it anywhere rocks. Ended up having a lot of fun playing!Doom is a very good game that I think everybody that loves first person shooters should play. There should tell you were to go because I got lost a long time in certain parts, and they should make your last a little bit long instead of dying so fast. Other then that it is a good game.I bought Doom a couple weeks ago.  So far, I love this game.  The graphics look great on switch.  Obviously not PS4 quality, but definitely better than ps3 quality.  The frame rate is really stable so far, and the game is just plain fun.  Love it!Doom ! Awesome just like the old one 're done revamped and perfect for the switch !I bought doom about a month ago and have been loving the multiplayer. One well armored player can easily overcome the odd of fight two opposing players if they didn't take the time to grab armor. Another fun challenge is to fight for survival just to grab one of the power weapons when eryone knows the location and when it is going to spawn.I played before on the PC but the aiming feature on the switch gives it a plus. It's amazing. I just love itGreat game! Glad it came to the Switch w/ excellent content & graphics!! So glad I purchased this for my son!As a person who frequented FPS games like Halo and COD on the Xbox, this seemed like a logical early purchase for my Switch. Overall, it's an excellent game. The campaign has good replay ability and is actually quite challenging, making it a rewarding experience to play through it. The graphics are excellent for a handheld device, really accentuating the carnage associated with the game. Haven't done much multiplayer yet, but from what I have experienced so far, the matchmaking works pretty well and is extremely competitive. Can't beat taking online multiplayer on-the-go.Don't let the specs turn you away from this game. It's still fun as heck, even undocked it's a blast.Amazing port very well done. I have this game on pc and it feels better to be honest. Most likely because i can take it to work. I can number 2 and play. I also played today while waiting on my significant other to grocery shop ahhhhhhhTons of fun, great fun. I was a little nervous after reading about some of the technical compromises that had to be made to bring this to the switch. But after playing it for countless hours i am very impressed. Graphics are nice game plays smooth. I have had one sound drop but it wasn’t bad ( kinda like someone turned my tv down a little) but the problem fixed it self. Great add to the switchOne of the best FPS is finally on a Nintendo console.I'm a huge fan of shooters and online shooters. This is hands down the best online multiplayer you'll ever have on a hand held. This is my first time playing the game but fully enjoying the experience. They took time with this port and its a amazing port from its original. The story line is straight forward not the most amazing thing you'll ever see or play through, but the multiple things and features including online multiplayer will entertain you for man man hours. In total great purchase, buy it.I am so glad I bought this game. I didn't pick up doom last year so I was new jumping into this game. I was skeptical too so I watched all of the early access reviews and heard all about the low res graphics and framerate issues, but... Now those reviews feel like pc gamer gripes. 30 fps at whatever blah, blah resolution feel like butter and look really amazing scaled down on a smaller screen. Docked mode not so much but it never soured my experience. This is a great port. If you haven't played doom or if you just want it on the go you wont be disappointed. This game is a must have for nintendo switch owners and at first 60 bucks kinda didn't sit right with me, but seeing how much work went into getting a game this demanding to run on the switch it is very much worth the price of admission. If you love your switch then buy this game, today, right now! I'm clapping my hands for panic button. I can't wait to see what they port next!

name: Dark Pictures: Man of Medan - PlayStation 4
review:
always have different outcomes based on your decisions. Plus a great begging to a series of games to comeIt is scary and challenging. I already beat it but are going to play it again to see if I can get different results. I'm going to do the same thing with the 2nd game in the series that I beat and will see if I can get different results. I can't we sit to try the 3rd one in the series!!Phenomenal gameplay and story with multiple endings.It's a great game with many possible that allows for a different ending each play throughI enjoyed the multiplayer aspect. My boyfriend and i enjoyed playing this game together. The graphics, characters, and gameplay is good. Would recommendThis game doesn’t live up to Supermassive’s “Until Dawn”. This game is extremely boring and not scary at all. The few attempts it makes to scare you just aren’t scary. It all takes place mainly on an old WW2 ship. It could have been so much more scary. It doesn’t have nearly as good of a setting as Until Dawn. The game just doesn’t seem polished or maybe even finished. This game and “Little Hope” are both this boring and not scary. Hope Supermassive takes a note from these bombs to create something much better the next time around. It’s also only 4 hours long and not worth the price. Definitely don’t recommend.Reminded a bit of Until Dawn but love it either wayI love these game makers, and their recent game man of Medan was all I had expected and more! Great game quality, and the horror and thrillers in the game are well thought out and not cheesy. You can tell that they put in the time while creating those game. Supermassive game makers have outdone themselves again. I highly recommend this one and then their previous games leading up to this one. It’s a great solo game as well as multiplayer if you take turns with friends or family.It isn't as good as Until Dawn and feels fairly short, bit but overall a decent game.This is the follow up game to Until Dawn and plays essentially the same way. You make decisions from 3 choices in a timed format or click the right button on a qte. Any and all characters can die and they've added a co-op and sharable game mode. If you liked Until Dawn you will like this as wellI loved Until Dawn, and seeing that this was by the same creators, quickly bought it. But it felt a LOT shorter than UD and the ending was pretty lack luster. I don’t know if it’s cause of my in-game choices, but yeah.I'll start by saying this game had great graphics.  It was really detailed, and was probably the only good part about this game.  
I was really excited to play this game because I loved Until Dawn.  I finished the game in less than a day, and honestly, this game is complete trash compared to Until Dawn.  I was expecting a lengthy game with a good plot, but I got a short game with a horrible plot.  
The game had so many glitches and bugs.  My screen would freeze and I'd miss quick-time events.  The jumpscares were average.  There is no closure on the plot, you never find out what happened on the ship.  After all the action in the beginning of the game, you'd think they would give you an explanation as to what happened but there wasn't any closure whatsoever.  The game was completely rushed and after I finished I was honestly a little bit mad that I wasted money on this.  They couldn't have put less effort into a game.  I would not recommend this game.  If you want to watch it, I suggest you watch Pewdiepie play it.  That way you won't waste your time.I bought this game because i really enjoyed “Until Dawn”. The concept is cool that the game is two player and you each control different people but something about the story wasn’t appealing to me. I just wasn’t feeling it.For those who loved other games by Supermassive Games (Until Dawn, Hidden Agenda), this is just as amazing. So scary I haven’t finished playing it because I’m a wimp lolThis game really does let you change the game based on your choices. Ran thru it in about 4 hours but a good playHard choices. Hard on the psyche.Takes away from the overall game enjoyment.

Visually, the game is great. The mood is proper, as is the plot. I recommend adjusting the 'reaction time' and quick-time event settings, because not all of us have razor-sharp reflexes. 

Overall, it feels like a 'choose your own adventure' style, and is fun if the settings are made proper for your playstyle.Interesting game great for groups of friends more like an interactive movie than a gameThe game has a great story.  The game has some very intense moments and definitely pulls you in as you play.Spooky fun and great to play with family or friends. It has jump scares, a decent storyline and the narrator just adds to the overall ambiance that you are playing in a horror game. It is not action-packed per say, but very strategic. You have to think and make hard decisions without a lot of time to do so, which can be super stressful and keeps you on the edge of your seat. The twist in the story is also well executed so I can't wait for the next installment as well as to replay the game!At first the controls and the general gameplay seems a bit awkward, but it makes sense after you get further into the game. The general plot is interesting, kind of like a modern twist-a-plot book from the 80`s. That's honestly the best part of this game is the element of changing now comes, although there's the usual plot line limitations. The character relationships are immature for my taste, being in my forties. But, for the younger generation, I guess it's normal for them. I think with a smoother flowing, more plausible plot, this game series would be excellent. The graphics are absolutely engaging.Im going to start off by saying that I am a big fan of these types of games ever since heavy rain. I love story driven games and the ones that have mostly quick time events usually have this element. However, I was kinda let down by this one. I really enjoyed until dawn so I was excited but this didn't have everything I wanted. For the most part I felt extremely board with the story. I honestly was not very interested. It seemed like a very safe go around and thats what the game was. So if your a fan of this game type you will probably like it but dont go in hoping for too much. Some of the redeeming qualities were the introduction of being able to play with friends and how you would get to choose your characters. Overall the game was meh but hopefully they get the next one right.Game would not load past the main title screen. If you don’t care who dies and when, sure play it.I've been craving to play another game as gripping as Until Dawn, and the Man of Medan does just that. I think that perhaps the dev team would be better served toning back the choice portion of the game for better storytelling. They certainly have talent. review: Only issue is that the USB ports do not support Fast Charging on the station. Tried charging my phone and it was going to take 6 hours.

name: EPOS H3 Hybrid Wired Closed Acoustic Universal Gaming Headset
review: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently got these H3 Hybrid headsets from EPOS. Right off the bat, they look very cute and stylish. They fit perfectly over my ears. On the right side, they have the sound control and on the left side they have the mic. Connecting it over Bluetooth is really easy and straight forward. Once connected, as soon as we turn it on, it automatically connects back to the same device. The sound is pretty clear and crisp. They are not that bulky. Adjusting the volume is like dialing a knob. Very easy. I am loving these headsets and I do not have any complaints so far. And yes, I would not think twice to recommend these to my friends, family and colleagues.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these H3 Hybrid Gaming Headsets for my son and I can't say enough. They fit perfectly are easy on the eats and provides great enjoyment. The sound is very clear and there have been no issues with them.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently received a pair of these headphones to try. They are amazing.  The sound quality is excellent. Pairing is very simple. They work really well with our gaming system.  I'm super excited to have these![This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The hybrid H3 gaming headset has great sound quality. I use them while playing my new playstation 5 and they sound perfect. I had not had any issues at all while using them. The headset is very durable and made nicely with high quality materials. They sit soft on my head, and are very comfortable while using. I am amazed by the sound quality, to me that is the most important while using a headset. I can hear so crisp and clear while using them, and it sounds so clear when I talk to other players. These are definitely a pair of epic headphones and I would definitely recommend.

Second, these are alkaline batteries.  This is the most common type you’ll see in the stores but it’s worth point out.  There are also a lot of so called Extra Heavy Duty batteries which actually use zinc not alkaline.  This type of battery will last less than half as long and are prone to leaking.

name: F1 2015 - Xbox One
review: Exciting game when you choose the right difficulty. Too easy and you're always ahead which makes it boring, but qhen you're realky battling with other cars it becomes and extremely exciting game. Could have have been a lot better with some aditional commentary especially when it comes to player's driving skills and progress to make it a lot more realisticNot what I expected. I enjoy the Forza games because I like designing my own paint schemes.

name: FINAL FANTASY TYPE-0 HD
review:
Excellent customer service!! Item arrived sooner than expected!! Highly recommended!!Overall, I liked this game. I played this after the FFXIII series, FFXV, and FF7 remake. The graphics are in the realm of FFXIII. Definitely, not as good as FFXV or 7 remake, but an older game, so that makes sense. There are elements of other older FF games - for those long time fans. I like being able to explore the overworld. Reminds me of the 1st and 6th games. The military campaign missions are fun. They remind me of the game of Risk. Leveling up is a bit of a chore, but XP grinds just go that way. Secret training missions are a quick way though, but that feels like cheating. The story is good, and detailed. It takes a second play through to pick up some of the nuances. I find the amount of characters a bit overwhelming, but I think it was done that way to make multiple play throughs fresh. Otherwise, it would get old quick. Trophies are realistic for those who care, but be prepared to work for some. I was a bit bummed about the music, some of it is okay, but I don't think I will like this soundtrack. The other FF games have always had the best music. Good for study and work type stuff. This one, ehh, not so much. In summary, fun, different, but not at the level of FFXV or remake 7. If you are a FF fan, you will like it, but for those just getting into the franchise, pass until you have tasted the excellence of the others. You owe it to yourself.Not the most impressed by the title. Gameplay is cunfusing at times. Good graphics for its time.A Great Game Experience for all fans of Final Fantasy Games!!!!!I’m not really into the retro fighting I’m more in to the next rpg as in XVVery intriguing story. The camera controls weren't perfect, but understandable because it is a port of a handheld game. Not all the characters are very interesting, but the combat is fun and there is a very intense ending.Very engaging but a little choppy on the story line. Still waiting to see if that pans out, it's early yet. Also mixes tactics with the normal final Fantasy gameplay. Can either be a plus or against it depending on how you feel about tactics.This is an old psp game ported to ps4 in hd I thought this game was pretty good but not as good as the other final fantasy games.It’s alright not a fan of the battle mechanics but it’s not too badNot user friendly, stale moves, and  not easy to follow.the war is hear  i like this finle fantasy tittle becuse of the ways its defrent from some of the other games ware the battle systume was half one thing and half another and the story for the game goes well and is a good lead in to finle fantasy 15 wich has a similer story and batte systumeVery low quality compared to prior games and FFXV the next game.This game is faster paced than i prefer. Also, the effects of what i try to do in combat arent always clear, kind of like FF15. Its ok, but i got FFX HD and am playing that instead. I put about 10 or so hours into Type 0. May or msy not go back to it.Considering this was a PSP->PS4 remake, looks great, sounds great, and plays fun. As a fan of both mainstrram and spin-off titles, happy to add this one to my play history!Amazing gameplay, filled with action and intuitive controls. The tutorial at the beginning is not the best but like I said intuitive controls make this hiccup forgetable.Now what I like in a game. The combat wasn’t fluid.I've always enjoyed the final fantasy series do I decided to try this out and it is a little different from the others I playedGame is much different than the other Final Fantasy titles because of its gameplay and overall freedom of exploration.This may be the best new final fantasy i have played in years. The graphics still look fairly psp in too many areas, but the game is a blast that mixes in story and gameplay elements from many different Final Fantasy games into one very interesting game. I feel that the more ff games you have played, the more you'll probably enjoy type 0. So if you're one of those people that has only played the 13 series, this may be too much for you, but if you're like me that has played all the numbers, and gets the references, this game is a good trip to take. ;DFinal Fantasy has always been about having an engaging story line and endearing you to a group of characters. After playing through the game I regret ever playing it and I will be turning it in. A game for me is never about the graphics because in a month of release they are old. This game lacked any type of effective story telling. I honestly by the end was calling them by their weapon names and finished this game simply because I felt compelled to hoping that at some point it would redeem itself. Some are saying this game is more mature and a "darker" Final Fantasy. Sorry, it's not darker. If you play final fantasy because you love a good story and love character development don't buy this because you will be sadly disappointed.This game is only tolerable by hardcore final fantasy gamers Im really surprised they released such garbage. This game would have only been good on a handheld but dont even waste your time trust me. STORY is completely confusing and just starts in the middle of no where.....Originally i had picked up this game mainly for the FF XV demo but i was curious to see how good it is. When i started playing i realized how fun it was. So glad i picked this game up. People who dislike it are either not fans of final fantasy or have not truly played this game enough. This game is literally one of the darkest stories in FF history as well as a nice change in the mature feel. There are tons of things to do in this game and being allowed multiple play throughs helps a ton. I definitely recommend this game to any hardcore FF fans and jrpg fans alike.After a play through, I just don't get it. I may have enjoyed this game as a hand held RPG back when it came out. As a full price PS4 game? It is as weak a title as you're going to find on this system. THE GOOD: Combat is relatively fun for a while if you can stomach the camera. THE BAD: About everything else. Poor graphics, cringeworthy voice acting (seriously the worst I can recall seeing in a major title), convoluted, fragmented storyline, uninspired environments, and missions that seem to mean absolutely nothing. The multiple character thing also really detracts from the weight of what little story there is, and it's very hard to care.An extremely frustrating game that becomes very monotonous between just simply completing tasks and using your free time before the next mission.

The game is very one-dimensional in it's combat design and I have just gotten tired of playing it. I thought it would be great as we have been anticipating a release of the game into the Americas for a while, but it's just so simple and easy.

On top of that, the game sports a glaring design flaw in which players are punished for preferring purely melee characters with limited ranged attack ability. It's becoming a recurring theme in the game industry to neglect melee oriented players when it comes to design and it absolutely needs to stop.

Yes it can be respected that melee characters shouldn't be ranged, but even our greatest real life athletes can perform dazzling aerial feats at inhuman speed every once in a while.

It's really frustrating when I encounter something I cannot fight because it is exclusively ranged and will not come down and fight me because it is like I am screwed from the second I decided which character I wanted to play most just because it's ranged attack capability is so limited.

I mean your AI allies are practically braindead anyway. Why does this game even have a party system? They just get in the way/waste resources.

I didn't expect a lot being that it was a PSP port but it's been a pretty disappointing experience. But Birth by Sleep and God Eater were pretty similar games and were done a lot better. Surprisingly good even for PSP games and I say that not to knock all PSP games but because of the genre of the game and limitations that a PSP will have compared to a console system with more buttons and superior control.

I have no outstanding opinion on the sound of the game, good or bad. Graphically, the camera's motion blur was very annoying but otherwise solid. Pretty game, but pretty boring gameplay unfortunately.

This game may be more suited to more casual gamers who are not as bothered by lack of polish on a game, but by the time I was at Chapter 7 I just didn't care what was going on in the story because I was bored out of my mind even playing the game.

I could go tons and tons more into detail with my disappointments but I don't really think it's fair to keep bagging on the game for reasons I have already stated (age, porting a game developed for a handheld).I want to say first that after playing the game for 10-15 hours, I plan on returning the game for store credit. It hasn't kept my attention and playing it feels more like a chore at this point. The graphics are decent, but look like they were rendered on a ps3 instead of a ps4. combined with the disgusting motion blur effect for even slightly turning your gaze really put a damper on the graphics as they are only good looking when you stand still.
I liked the swap-out system for characters, and magic requirements for different spells felt natural. having to keep 12 characters leveled up and geared out at once was kind of annoying at first but I got used to it.

I would not recomend this game simply because it feels like it was slapped together, and still has some very obvious kinks to be worked out.There are waaaay too many characters and you can sort of tell from the gameplay and graphics that Type 0 is originally for the PSP, but other than that, the game was fairly decent. The story was good overall. If there's anything bad to say about the story telling, it's that it was slightly predictable. The gameplay was unique to other FF games and it was an action RPG instead of turn-based so that was fun in its own way. If you're a fan of Final Fantasy, this isn't a bad game to get. It also comes with a demo of FFXV, so why not?I love Final Fantasy I love JRPGs and I love this game the story is excellent, the graphics are breath taking, the camera is a little odd but all around good. I love the gamecame out beast like the previews.. its nice to have a final fantasy in the series that's more open combat.This game is different from the other FF games because it is really dark. There is a decent amount of blood and destruction which kind of grips you. As far as all of the people complaining about the story and elements being so confusing, I don't really think they bothered to watch the in game CGs or read the in game historical texts. It is not that confusing and every element is explained if you take the time to look and listen. There are 3 levels of difficulty in the game and even on Cadet, it can be somewhat of a challenge. I grew up with turned based JRPGs and to write off this game because isn't turn based is a shame. Limiting yourself is unfortunate because the game is actually very good and provides well over 100 hours worth of content, replay, and activities. The camera can get you a little dazed but it isn't a deal breaker. The graphics could have certainly been remastered a little better but there are moments when the game looks absolutely fantastic. I use the remote play feature on my Vita sometimes and it plays amazingly considering it was originally a psp game. Square Enix should have offered this game as a Vita title as well but that is a different issue. The FF XV demo was a very nice addition and does take some getting used to. I own FF 1 through 14 and enjoy each game for its differences and uniqueness. None of them are perfect but they all offer something decent towards the Final Fantasy series.I really don't understand why people say this isn't a Final Fantasy game. It's just an action-RPG, not a turn-based. It's a very refreshing change to the series. People complain that there are ranged enemies and they are using a full melee squad, well that's just dumb. It's still a Final Fantasy game so tactics are still used, a lot. You have to make a team that makes sense. If you play the turn-based versions, you wouldn't put 4 Tanks or 4 DPS in at once, why? Because it's stupid. That aside the combat is fun, given you have the brains to make the fun happen. Some characters are useless, a lot of them are really interesting. You can tell the graphics come from PSP. There are way too many characters to keep leveled, though. The story is meh, very predictable. If you are a fan of action-RPG's this is definitely a fantastic game to get.First of all, I would like to state that I know that this is a remake of the Japanese version of a hand held console. I understand this completely. I am a HUGE Final Fantasy buff and have been waiting for this for a long time. The games story is somewhat vague, but good enough to follow. I would have expected that they would have done a better job with the graphics and gameplay motion. The game was so choppy and unclear that I sometimes could not even follow what I myself were trying to do. This is not what I have become accustomed to when playing a game on the PS4. All in all it is worth the money to buy and play simply because you are a Final Fantasy fan, but for a regular gamer, I would not recommend this. The best thing about this game coming out was the Final Fantasy XV demo. That part was fantastic.I got the day one edition and I never heard of this classic game. Overall it is really good. The controls to play are completely different from other Final Fantasy so it will take time to adjust. The graphics and gameplay is really good. If you got the day one Edition then it will come with a code for Final Fantasy XV demo. Overall if you want to try something that is different from many other Final Fantasy games then this be the way to go. It is impressive.The gameplay is almost straight from Dirge of Cerberus (sp) and can be a bit hectic at first. I hate how everything is the square button when there are buttons we don't even use. You can also tell this game was made for the PSP. I also think there are way too many characters to choose from. The war missions are kinda cool but I get tired of constantly worrying if I am missing anything. I would recommend this game for the free demo it comes with. If your a long time fan then you'll enjoy this game enough to play it twice, which is whats expected, otherwise wait till 15.Type-0 is an okay game, I haven't finished the game yet but the story line is interesting enough to keep playing. The beginning of this game is what impressed me the most. The story telling and the emotional impact of the drama I found was like no other final fantasy. War is depicted in this game as ruthless, bloody, and ugly. An army ravaging a city hellbent on victory. You witness the slaughter of many. Those who are innocent civilians, those who at the moment of dying being finished off without hesitation. Then you witness one with the will to survive. It's agonizing to watch someone dying but at the same time inspiring to see the will to live. After the opening events I was left very solemn but excited to start playing this game. Probably the best opening to any Final Fantasy. I've played this game quite a bit but it doesn't continue with the same intensity of story telling. Then again i'm sure it has some great moments I haven't reached yet. It's a very unique game, kind of reminds me of Persona 4 somewhat. Type-0 actually blends quite a bit of other final fantasy elements into this game. I'm really not being really critical of this game, not everyone will enjoy certain aspects. I really think the level development/outlay of the areas you visit are basic/simple at best. Although i'm only 3 to 4 hours into this game, from what I saw this seems to be the norm. I'm positive this game will have quite a bit of replay value. More characters then any other Final Fantasy you will have at your disposal. Difficulty selection will be nice for the hardcore gamer. I started on the officer difficulty and it's not that challenging, at least not for me. The graphics are okay i'm not complaining. Although some people might think it's garbage because it doesn't resemble a next gen PlayStation 4 game. It's in high definition its very smooth/fluid. The textures such as the grass are not bad but then again it doesn't look like Final Fantasy XV. Speaking of Final Fantasy XV you get a code to download it. It's around 5.2 Gigabytes so download it. It's really fun, open world, great graphics, and a new fighting system. This demo is worth the purchase of Type-0 in my opinion. The demo will take you a few hours to complete, which is good because you won't finish it too fast. The time changes from day to night. The night invites tougher monsters for an added challenge and gains the group some experience you will get to reap once you rest at a campground. There's witty banter between the group as you explore the world which makes the travel a little more interesting as you travel to objectives. Getting in a battle, the enemy sees you a red line flashes across the screen until it expands the entire width of the screen. You can also hide by pressing/holding the L2 button, then get out of view behind a tree, or rock. It's also a really suspenseful game you will see once you start the hunt for "Dead eye." Also you will find a summon, you will like this A LOT! I did, but don't take my word for it, try it out yourself. Thanks for reading, hope my reviews helps.I found this to be a great game different then older ones but still interesting I though it was great getting XV's demo with it alsoXV's demo was pretty good definitely looking forward to XV coming out!

name: Fallout 4 - PlayStation 4
review:

I've always wanted to get into Fallout and due to my console, this is where I started. Definitely recommend, the quests are easy to follow and game is pristine. Game comes with case and instruction booklet.Fun and a good Fallout game. Could have a little better graphics...Great game. Graphics are fantastic, and the gameplay is classic Bethesda.Its the fallout engine and world you know so well but with a focus on building little fortified communes for people to live in which makes all that scavenging that is so addictive, worth something. Anything you can store in inventory can be used to build something however, if you have an internet connection, you can access mods for free and just have toolboxs of unlimted materials waiting at each location. Its hard to resist that and if you do that , youll sorta negate the reason for collecting anything other than ammo, weapons, armor, clothes and whatever you like to display in your home and camps. The beauty of that was that for me, it didnt ruin the game , being a god right off the bat with all my goodies was just awesome. Im here to explore and do whatever i want since the world ended. The game is a blast and its funny and smart but the characters could have been more original like in Fallout 2 or 3. Even new vegas had great npcs and this one does too just not as many. The graphics on the Pro i use are just awesome. The colors in the game are vibrant its defiantly the best fallout game in the 3d universe made so far. Worth it. Gun physics are better and the way eneimes react to gettin hit by each shot after a certain perk is got adds fantastic realism. Shooting living things never felt so satisfying.It’s a good game I just cannot get into it too much like I used to.Fallout is always a fun game and this one does not disappoint at all.Fantastic game the story and gameplay feel so smooth and make senseReally dumb that you think your essential. Otherwise purchase was fine.Loved it. It very fun and you have options to use mods and the fact that you can have a dov is awesomeAlways Loved the fallout series.

Who you’re in league with does effect the difficulty of the game toward the end, and at that point I was in the good graces of only one of the three groups. The wrong one at that. It all works out fine if you can use your power suit to overcome the extra level of difficulty. Pay attention to what the different groups say about each other and you might change your opinion about whos side you’re on. Vast post-atomic bomb world with fantastic 50s-inspired theme. I love the ambient 50s bee-bop music playing on the occasional radio you come across in some abandoned building, the cute sci-fi-inspired name of food and household products, the old metal lawn furniture and funky old rusted out cars lying all over the wasteland. You're equipped with a "wearable" computer that displays in old analog monochromatic interface like old terminals, and Vault Boy is your friendly avatar that is animated to show you how things work. It was initially thrilling, unique and held so much promise. I loved exploring, the immersion was enjoyable, and "building" my character and my shelters felt ,well, reasonable depending on the situations I stumbled into. But then upon replaying a few times, I realized it was extremely lacking in the "RPG" elements it claimed to boast. The choices are limited, and the plot/ steering devices (by which I mean the game practically guides you along) felt rather immersion breaking , and overall lazy. Fallout 4 provides a familiar feel to its predecessors, but it is all new locations tied to a compelling narrative. I play on a standard PS4 and the graphics are wonderful, the controls are smooth, and sound is engaging.
There are some minor issues with subtitles and the conversation camera angels seem arbitrary and strange (but both can be turned off in settings). I have not completed the game yet, but I can still say it is just what fans of the series would expect with a low cost to entry for first time Fallout players.

ITS A TERRIBLE GAME AND IT SHOULD HAVE NEVER EVER EVER EVER EVER BEEN MADE.....Story not as good as fallout 3 and new vegas but gameplay is amazing variety of weapons and many quest and good features.I've played Fallout 4 a lot, I've spent 170 hours playing it on steam and another 50 or so hours on PS4. The game is a shooter/RPG combo, much like its predecessors Fallout 3 and Fallout: New Vegas. There are changes that have been made to this installment though, some of them help it really shine, but some of them feel like the game may be abandoning its core audience. As opposed to the previous games in the series, this game is very action oriented. You will find yourself using the new sprint function a lot, and in lots of high energy shootouts. I enjoyed the adrenaline rushes from these segments, but I can see why hardcore Fallout fans could see this as a negative. There have been many changes to the stats of the game, skill are completely gone, replaced by perks that you unlock as you level up. This system was implemented to avoid being perfect at everything I think, but it doesn't really work because a lot of perks that improve your skills don't have very high requirements in their respective "S.P.E.C.I.A.L" (What represents attributes that would be in other RPG's. A settlement system has also been implemented, although not very well in my opinion. Lots of your custom homes will probably end up looking like stacked squares, or maybe I just suck at the home building, either way I didn't get much out of it. The storyline is alright, having a branching story that involves 4 factions trying to obtain control over the commonwealth (The area in which Fallout 4 takes place), and to avoid spoilers, all I'll say is that there are really only 2 factions with fully developed stories, and really 2 distinct endings, although the monologue is the same with every ending, which is very disappointing. The dialogue system has been simplified, tossing a lot of flavor text, which wasn't really a bother or a credit to me, it was kinda just there. If you're looking for a fun RPG/Shooter that leans more on the shooter side to sink a lot of time into, Fallout 4 is the game for you. If you want to play Fallout 3/New Vegas in a new engine, you might just wanna skip this one. Oh, and as typical of Bethesda, lots of bugs and crashes.this game is beyond what I expected! The gameplay was solid, the music was perfect, and the story was well crafted. A true successer to fallout 3!!This is an enjoyable game with multiple endings. I would recommend getting the DLC also. Finally, fallout 4 is a great game and people should not be deterred from buying from my review.Fallout 4 is a step back from Fallout 3 and New Vegas, and really shows that Bethesda has failed to innovate much in terms of their game engine, graphics, or gameplay. There is not enough side quests in this game and after you go around looking at places, you slowly start to realize that there is not much else to do. The repeating quests are annoying after some time and you just stop doing those. I saw a comparison between quests in Fallout 4 and Skyrim. Skyrim nearly doubles all of Fallout 4's quests all together, so it sucks that Bethesda didn't add more. Now this is where DLC comes into play so people will have to buy dlc to be able to play more quests. The other Fallout games seem to have more things to do in my opinion. Although, Fallout 4 has lots of different MAIN quests that include I think 3-4 different factions to choose from so returning back to the game and trying something new is always something to look forward to. But I noticed that within the first 10 mins of the game, I felt like something was missing. I'm still not sure why I thought/think that but it just didn't have the full Fallout feel to it even though it is a wasteland. Overall I still like the game, but am disappointed in the lack of quests in the game. I guess the only thing to really look up to is the mods which hopefully come to xbox/ps4, and to see how well the dlc plays out. 7.5/10Fallout 4 is one of those special games that only happened once in a blue moon, if you haven't gotten around to playing it yet, get to it! You won't be disappointed.The game is amazing! Everything about it is awesome i just can't wait to see what they have coming for dlc. This is a must get game.good game. its good. goo game play. good everything. i play for hours. its good. its nice. its cool.This game is pure great. Do I snipe, shotgun, pistol, melee or do I pull out my power armor to kill with? There just too many ways to go into a battle.The minute I started playing I was hooked.
