The game has not let me down, and the only bad thing I have to say (besides the gliches) is that the story is not as good as New Vegas's story.I will acknowledge that there is a lot about this game that is amazing. My main complaints are the very common crashes and bugs. There is nothing worse than having your game crash and having to redo what you just did. My game has crashed at least 15 times and I have gotten stuck in places and had to reload at least 5. After lvl 20 I had to play on the hardest difficulty to have any fun, and even then the only real challenge is finding ammo. I have tossed out 95% of the "Legendary" Armor and weapons I get because they are pointless. This game was clearly produced with giant holes they intend to fill later with dlc. New weapons, power armor upgrades, new furniture etc. I have used the same gun for 30lvls. Building a village was one thing I was seriously looking forward to but they managed to ruin it, by making it mostly cosmetic and tedious. The best guns and armor will always be bought elsewhere, and having a camp barely helps you in game and constantly having to build and defend new ones with no gain gets old quick. It could be a great game. Bethesda has great ideas, but putting out a bug infested game that's not finished was a bad idea.I first played Fallout 3 when it came out. I then played Fallout New Vegas when it came out. First thing I did was buy Fallout 4 and I enjoyed it a lot. The story line was great and the graphics looked much more realistic than its prequels had before.I've waited 3 weeks to pass judgment on this game, so I could fully try out everything and experience as much as I could. First off, I've had a lot of fun playing it. It was tough at first, but I got to be at a level playing field with the mobs at around level 15. There were times when I would roll through what looked liked a deserted town, just to find out it was full of ghouls that would attack you like zombies from the movie 28 Days. I really started to enjoy myself then. There's so much to do, between quest missions, building settlements, scavenging for supplies, and just exploring the world. At first, I had a lot of fun building the settlements, building defenses, and walling off the perimeter to protect the settlement. Just to find out, it's pretty much all for nothing. If you don't see the little notification of a settlement being attacked (because your on a quest, in the workshop menu, or just plain distracted at the time) since you have to be there to defend it, you'll go back to all your crops, defenses, and generators wrecked and having to be repaired. It's quite frustrating to have 40 water, 40 food, 20 settlers, and 140 defense, just to find out it's all for nothing if you can't be there to help defend. The whole point of building these defenses, is to leave the settlement knowing they are defended. But if you're not there to help defend it, a few raiders can just walk in and destroy everything. Pretty dumb and a waste of time if you ask me. I even tried double walls on one of my smaller settlements with no way in or out, only way in was to fast travel to the marker inside the walls. And it still got wrecked!! So don't waste too much of your time or resources building up defenses, cause it won't matter if you're not there to defend it and you'll just have to use a lot more resources to repair everything. Other than that, I really enjoy the game. The sounds of distant firefights in the distance, that you can join in or avoid, is outstanding. The way you can collect different power armor suits is great. I haven't ran into any of the bugs that have been reported, so I've been lucky there. Just remember to save often.I'm not all too pleased with this purchase. I'll tell you my biggest peeve with this game, you know how in Fallout 3, you had to work real hard for your power armor? Well in this one, you're handed your armor in the first like 3 missions. Yep, now you have a set of (over) power(ed) armor to use the rest of the game. Albeit, they require fusion cores to operate, which you find very scarcely. Other than that, it really just feels like Fallout 3 with amazing graphics. Nothing much new here, pretty disappointed. I would recommend to a friend just because I know this is just my feeling about this game, a ton of others love it. I literally spent hours build walls and fortifying each settlement.I have yet to play the game but the graphics look amazing. Can't wait to get it. Hope to get it for Christmas.When you hear about a game company spending 4 years making a game you expect it to be good...no you expect it to be freaking awesome and that my friends is what Bethesda has done with Fallout 4. I've you have played any of the previous games than you know what you are in for! A massive world with so much to explore. As always there is the main story line quests but you don't have to stay on them for long. Afterall, there is a HUGE world to explore. A lot of elements are brought into this game from it's older versions but there is so much new stuff as well. So do I like it?? Well of course I do. A game that is so massive and open and that lets you make your own dang mind up about what you will do and how you will respond is right up my alley. If you like those things and don't have this game yet..WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? Head on over to your local Gamestop and then be prepared to say goodbye to your entire life. You won't want to put your control down....ok ok maybe just to use the bathroom because if you didn't do that...oh ugh never mind! GET FALLOUT 4!I had really high hopes for this game when I heard it was being released. I just finished today and I was so disappointed with it that it made me write my first review about a game. There was too much copy and paste, it felt like i was doing the same mission over and over. No variety! All I heard about was how advanced the crafting system will be... Really!! What crafting system? You can't craft anything, all you can do is MODIFY the weapons and armor you find, and all the armor you find is the same stuff you find in Fallout 3. Nothing different! Think about how much better Skyrim was then oblivion and the Witcher 3 over the Witcher 2, i was expecting that kind of jump with this game, especially with it being on the new generation console! It failed horribly, it's Fallout 3 with better graphics.When I first got this I was very skeptical and didn't know what to think. If you are contemplating whether or not to get this game I extremely recommend it. One of the top games I have played in a very long time!This a grate game if u haven't purchesed online its a huge open world sandbox game it has endless things to do its a grate game I'm nit a flip in robot So a real person saying this JUST BUY IT WHO WATS FALLOUT TO BE GAME OF THE YEAR :D?.....no one we'll u suck lol BUYYYYYYNot only do you get to play this amazing new chapter in fallout, you get to be part of creating this new world.This is a very good game, so here is a list of pros and cons because I don't want to write paragraphs for the viewers who are just looking for quick reviews. .....Pros: good story, love the fact that there is a dog following you around and helping, love the customization, building settlements is fun and I like the shooting system.....Cons: graphics could be better but not a big deal, I don't like the fact that the pond by a settlement I have can't have the radiation removed an the last thing is that this game is much harder than the previous fallouts. Before I list what I love but I will point out what I see as the two main issues. 1. They really hindered role playing. Not a huge thing for me but I know this really bothers a lot of people. The voiced protagonist and dialogue options really hurt this method of playing. 2. They removed the karma system. This really bothers me as I always saw this as a really cool defining characteristic of the Fallout series and I just don't understand why they would remove this. This also kind of ties in to the first issue. However, they really did make an excellent game. I think the synth story line really encapsulates the red scare era that Fallout has always had. (Your neighbor could be a synth!/ Your neighbor could be a commie!) The base building has eaten away hours of my life, it's incredible. You are able to build and customize just about anything and don't forget about all those amazing perks to make your character just as awesome as you are. Cheers!Aside from a grueling walk. This game raises the bar for how games should be when done right. I have next to no problems. A few glitches here and there but for such a vast world that has been built. I see no reason why this game should not be game of the year. I commend the developers into putting such detail into a marvelous earthbound journey and await the next adventure to come.I personally like this game. Yeah it has some glitches, hopefully Bethesda will fix soon. The targeting is off and the pip-boy will not open up after building in a settlement. I like being able to build stuff. The downside of this game is the fusion cores needed for the power armor and when you get rads it now makes your health bar red preventing you from healing all the way. Overall it's still a good game and I am having a-lot of fun playing it.This game has left a ton to the imagination and has completely lived up to its hype. Amazing open world, good graphics, gameplay to die for. This is a must buy game and will definitely be GOTYAnother fallout and another success for Bethesda. I love this game. Imy looking forward to putting in the hours to complete everything.I was worried at first that this game wasn't going to live up to the hype. I'm relieved to say that this game is a step in the right direction for the "Fallout" series.I'm going to start this with a reminder that unlike what some would like to believe, this is MY opinion. Whether or not you like it is up to you.

Fallout 3 and New Vegas to me were great games although their charm wore off quickly or started just a little too slowly for my taste. They wouldn't last long on consoles but for PC they're pretty much INFINITELY replayable due to its modding community. This game nailed the pacing.

Initially as I started, it felt a little weird playing this. Not due to sloppy controls but more due to the extensive changes made to the UI. After about an hour or two with the game though it quickly wears off, as pretty soon you'll just as fast or even faster than you would in the previous Fallout games. The game controls nicely and feels fluid. This was especially good because in the last two the controls were kinda stiff and occasionally acted weird but this made it work fast and not drop input as often as I thought it would.

The graphics, while great have some issues. I noticed some strange lighting in certain areas where there wasn't a source which struck me as odd and kind of took me out but otherwise was done quite well. Some textures are kinda low res but with a game this size I'm not surprised at it. Otherwise this game is gorgeous. Bethesda's efforts at overhauling a game that still admittedly had that 2007 feel to them was not wasted, and for the most part everything works the way it should. The colors while you might think is something superfluous, I think matters. In this Fallout, its bright but still has that level of wear and tear from both the nuclear bomb damage and 200 years of everything thrown its way. Rather than maintaining that same muddy color scheme that tended to look rather depressing at times, the pre-war setting still at least has some soul to it.

For gameplay it's gotten quite a few new additions. Besides the standard shooter mechanics which have been round off quite well, Bethesda now shows us what it means to have a deeper sense of interactivity. Modding weapons returns from New Vegas returns with quite a twist, allowing for mods to be created from scratch using the new scrap system and they aren't just for looks or some minor buff, these are mods that have trade offs but also huge advantages to allow different playstyles to emerge. The settlements, while I think a good idea on paper, tend to feel like they get in the way. I never thought that they shouldn't be implemented, but I find that constantly being shown that a base isn't operating well at all when I was just starting out to be annoying, as it almost expected me to just drop my initial questing to fix things up with zero scrap. If it were up to me, I would have allowed it at a little bit of a later level, when you've gotten most of your startup out of the way. Cooking has now been implemented, which actually is somewhat good, as cooked food will be much better for you than just eating stuff raw. Speaking of which, the health system has been revised as well. Instead of having a RAD counter, it now sort of locks off part of your health bar which makes sense to me, and food/healing items are now all time based which makes for some extra planning. V.A.T.S. and the AP system have also gotten some changes with V.A.T.S. no longer pausing action completely, but slowing it down to add a little bit more of that hectic feel to a fight and you can now sprint which uses AP. Critical hits are measured on a meter and kills in V.A.T.S. raises it, encouraging you to use it. The Leveling system is an interesting one. Most fans of the previous Fallout games will say that the removal of the skill system is some form of sacrilege but I find it to be fine. Rather than having skills and perks, your S.P.E.C.I.A.L. stats are now the determining factor of the perks you get. Leveling up gives you one allocation point that can be either applied to one of the perk levels on a S.P.E.C.I.A.L. or the S.P.E.C.I.A.L. attribute itself. There is no longer a level cap which is quite nice and allows for the possibility of fully leveling a character. You know that previous junk that you probably only used once in a blue moon with the Rock-it Launcher? Now it's part of the scrap system, where you will desperately searching for anything that you can use to craft weapon mods or things for your settlements, and it can get quite hectic at times. No longer are all items you find pointless. Power Armor has changed as well. Previous games saw you getting a perk that allowed you to wear the armor and then you would wear it for the forseeable future due to its potent effects compared to most other armor. Now, Power Armor has its own unique feel. Rather than acting like a second skin which wasn't supposed to be the intent based on the art design, Power Armor has impact. You really feel like a hulking monster walking around in a suit that allows for you to hit the snot out of your enemies and other kinds of things. While this may make it sound like its even more overpowered than before, it isn't and that's because it requires a fusion core to work, otherwise you'll be forced to walk around and you won't able to use V.A.T.S. while inside an empty suit. It also can take damage on specific parts so your limbs can be exposed if you take too much damage. Armor customization has also become a feature which applies to both the power armor and normal armor. Normal armor allows for you to choose a base (Vault 111 suit, long johns, harness, etc.), Right arm plating, Left arm plating, Right leg plating, Left leg plating, and a helmet, glasses and mouth covering or just a full helmet/mask. Power armor uses the mainframe of any suit but allows for different effects to be applied to different areas to allow for playstyle.

The story is one where a simple motivation is all it needed. Is it perfect? Not all the time, the writing can fail to make you feel something but most of the time, you definitely feel as though you make an impact based upon your actions. The whole goal of the game is to find your son Shaun, but the side-quests add more variety for the player. As with most RPGs side-quests can become repetitive, but with mediation between your main/faction quests and side-quests can allow for a better feeling of satisfaction. In the title you may have noticed the word epic. If you're thinking that it was just a buzzword, then you've got the wrong meaning. The story is an epic just like say Odyssey. You've got a simple goal that is made monumental in scope, with some plot digressions to mix things up a bit. I never felt as though the game ran stale, though I imagine as time passes and people "complete" the game, it could lose some value but there is one last thing to save the console versions of the game.

Bethesda announced mod support for consoles. Yes, you read that right, mod support. For too long, the console versions were inferior to the PC because you were never allowed to modify your experience. Sometime in 2016, the Creation Kit for Fallout 4 along with the mod support for Xbox One and PS4 will be added and allow for much more interesting experiences once you've finished your main game. This is already on top of DLCs and a reasonably priced Season Pass.

In conclusion, Fallout 4 is a game you will want. With so much content and (mostly) good writing at your hands, you will be able to experience things only this series can bring, and the ability to modify will undoubtedly be a major factor in this game's lifespan. If you can overlook the minor things to be expect of a game this large, you can have a great experience.

TL;DR: Mostly good graphics, great wealth of additions to gameplay to switch things up, story is mostly good with some writing falling to pieces, Mod support will expand lifespan, new UI may throw you off but is otherwise easy to use.This is one of those games that are going to be time consuming but every moment will be a good one. I love that fact that you weapons are upgradeable and do not degrade. I didn't like fallout when I first started playing, But know I am a fan. Once I got the mechanics of the fallout while playing fallout 3, I was hooked. I love story driven games Assassin's Creed, Metal Gear Solid and Fallout are my three favorite franchises. in the world of Fallout, Fallout 4 is a masterpiece I love this game.I was pumped about this game as I loved Fallout 3 and New Vegas, but this game doesn't appear to have any upgrade over those predecessors. That may be okay to some, but I was expecting much much more. The graphics are horrible for a PS4. So many glitches, choppy actions, poor AI, poor targeting for the activate icon... the list goes on. The action is choppy and boring. There NEEDS to be better autosave. Multiple times I had been exploring for 30+ minutes and then some mutant radscorpion or something would appear and make short work of me at earlier levels and I'd lose everything since my last user save. I understand that many people just want an immersive environment to explore unimpeded and they don't care much about the graphics or gameplay as long as they can train their characters, so to them it will be a blast. But for guys that want a game you can play for an hour or 2 at a time and enjoy this couldn't be worse. This is coming from someone who loves Skyrim, Dragon Age, KOTORs and many other massive RPGs.The VATS system had me missing shots i realistically shouldn't have. The graphics are horrible, the sound cuts out, there is literally no end to the lag. I don't see why everyone loves this game so much, it is just awful.The reason for this is simple, they made this almost completely different from Fallout 3 & New Vegas. The story I can't relate to it in a Fallout style because it feels to much like a Call of Duty shooter style where you have to go and absolutely kill EVERYTHING. And yes I emphasized that because when you have to kill an area it basically anything in that area no way around. It now a shooter more so than an RPG style.

The dialog lacks a bit, the characters don't show emotions as well as I expected they would. It more or less the same outcome despite what decision you make, you can't really go in a different direction all together.

Now an aspect I do like, but it not quite enough for me to refer this game is I love the crafting, but it doesn't keep a lasting appeal for to long considering there are other games out there with crafting now that have a better purpose.

And I like the outfit choice coming back where you can wear anything you want to and it doesn't change how people see you.

Basically I gave it a five star as a moral rating if anything because there pretty equal features I like and don't like. They just have different type of standing in the game.

name: Garmin Venu Sq Music Smartwatch
review:
I had received this smartwatch as a christmas gift and thus far havent had an issue with it. It seems similar to the old pebble smartwatch I had a few years ago but its much better designed and has support for controlling media on my phone. All-in-all the watch does as required and has a few neat features as well.Can't seem to download my music playlist, not as easy as it saysI got this watch as a gift about 3 weeks ago. I love how it tracks not only steps, but body battery, heart rate, stress level, etc. The emergency contact feature is very cool to keep people safe. It hooks up to headphones easily and makes your music to easy to get to. My only real complaint is the battery life. It oy last 3 to 4 days before I have to charge it again with little use, where as my Fitbit would last 7 to 9 days. All around it is a great watch and I have it personalized completely to my liking.This product was purchased as a gift for my son. He decided he wanted to go a different route. Best gift I ever got. The features of this watch are easy to use. I love being notified of text and email messages and the music download feature is convenient when at work. Having had competitors product, this has exceeded my expectations.I got this for Christmas will not play Music. Very disappointed with this tracker.The watch does everything I wanted a watch to do. Provides me with all the tracking information I want for my activities and sleep. Plus I have downloaded all my playlists from my Spotify account  to listen on my earbuds without carrying my phone with me.Date numbers should be larger with pre-installed watch facesReceived this as a Christmas gift and I love it !!! But still a lot of features that I need to exploreThe device is working properly, but it’s a bit more than I need. I’m struggling to track my runs through the device or the app. At one point a great run got messed up and I couldn’t adjust it- very frustrating! It’s user error, but don’t buy more device than you need.Love the watch. Great price. No, it doesn’t have all the bells and whistles but it does what I need it to do.A perfect gadget for health tracking, every day training and activities made accurate and simple. Its slim design makes it easy to wear it all day long even when sleeping.  Bright screen clear to read under sunlight and moving. Gotta say although hydration widget doesnt works very well and i was looking forward to use this a lot. Also there are not so many compatible watchfaces, nor activities/datascreens on Connect IQ, which was a little dissapointing. But overall it performs well.Love my Venu! Great features, looks sleek and super motivating.It was a Christmas present. I love open water swimming so I was excited to get a Garmin watch that my husband had been told would be suitable and the shop. Now I have to figure how how to get it to track open water swimming.It won’t stay linked to iPhone screen already had scratch marksThis is my first Garmin, so the learning curve was steeper for me. Beautiful display, fun watch faces to play with, tracks loads of activities. Waterproof in the pool. I'm having to charge it nightly, but I have been playing with it a lot. I haven't yet used the gps function. I do know the swipe across to change screens isn't working as well for me as the dial would. Next one for me will have a dial to change screens and will be solar powered.Rather complicated and touchy, would like time visual all the time and too much to handleI bought this in Tuesday, the battery lasted so long.
All the features in the watch work well and fulfilled my needs.Screen doesn’t react to swipes, taps etc. we have tried everything. My husband has a smart watch with which he has no problems & he couldn’t get this one to work at allI bought this a month ago, and overall, I like its features. It tracks my runs. It tracks my hydration. It plays music after 30-60 minutes of set up. 

It is definitely not perfect. The connection isn't amazing. The screen is already scratched up from running and a desk job. I don't know what I am going to do about the screen. That is probably the most disappointing part. Don't wear it on the inside of your wrist.I bought this to record high intensity workouts for the health program through work. The battery life is good and it's comfortable. The strength app isn't super easy or intuitive to use but I like that I can edit workouts later. The one major feature missing for me is a medicine tracker (did I take it today, not a reminder). I have to record 1 second of martial arts every morning to remember if I took my pill. Even if I could add a custom type of workout that would satisfy it. I also wish it could dynamically set an alarm based on where you are at in your sleep cycle around the time of your normal wake-up time.I have owned a very large number of running watches and even tried the other guys but I kept coming back to Garmin.  I have now found the perfect watch for me. It has a very readable screen and great functions.  Easy to operate with great graphics.  Love the square shape too. Nothing but love for this perfect watchNot sure how but top R corner chipped and cracked screen after 1 run. Yikes!!Just received the watch today.   trying to set it up.   the Connect app crashes /freezes during set up.   The watch arrived set in Spanish i think.   how the heck do you change language settings?This watch is everything I needed. I am training for a half marathon and it has been great to have music in my runs without my phone with me.I've had this watch about 3 weeks. I wish the text size on the watch was bigger and that I can use my apple music app. All other features are great!This watch with the app is remarkable. So many ways to track about every aspect of health and the venu sq sensors are very accurate.I got the new Venu Sq as a bday gift. I'd been rockin' the Vivoactive for several years now and it was about time for an upgrade. I didn't want a round face so I was stoked when this model offered the square face. I love all the extra activities that this watch offers and still waterPROOF, I've yet to drown one and I swim a lot. I am loving the HR and other health monitors that I didn't have on my OG Vivo. My partner worries about me going for long runs when I sometimes don't take my phone (stupid shorts with no pockets), so the safety features that the Venu Sq offer are phenomenal. Also always having music is great. The battery lasts for days and I go on a GPS run every morning and a bike ride every afternoon and it seems to last forever. All in all super happy with the upgrade.Bought it a month ago. Love it but can't get the spirometer to workI bought this about 2 weeks ago, and I am quite satisfied with the performance I have been getting with the product.
Pros:
1. Good enough battery life: If you just use the GPS to track your activity, it will last you for about 4 days on a single full charge, assuming you do a normal amount of activity per day (~1-2 hrs/day).
2. UI: I personally like the UI very much, you can go around and change stuff, and also have the Garmin Connect and Connect IQ app support.

Cons:
1. GPS: It can take about 5 seconds before the watch will lock your GPS location, and that can be a little irritating sometimes. Also, sometimes the watch will get the wrong location at the start and/or the end of your activity, and hence the top speed achieved for that activity would come out to be something insane like 40 km/h or something.
2. Battery life WITH music: I cannot really complain about this, since the company only claims 6 hours with GPS and music on. But I would have loved to have a longer battery life with music.

Overall, if you want to begin your fitness journey with a good smartwatch, this is the option for you.Me acaba de llegar el reloj y me parece perfecto, el color, la forma y algunas de las animaciones que tiene así como la aplicación, sin embargo en esta versión de música que compré no está YouTube Music, en la cual tengo mi membresía ya paga, sería bueno si pudiesen agregarla.I really love my Venu Sq plus. Most if the activities I don't even do and it's not easy going from 1 screen to the next. I'm considering sending it back maybe for something less expensive and less complicatedStable bluetooth connection is basically impossible. It pairs easily but will disconnect constantly, the watch interface is extremely clunky and difficult to navigate. I've had zero connection issues with each Fitbit I've owned in the past. Probably a great watch with incredible features i was wanting but the connectivity issues was a deal breaker.I had it for 3 days and love the feathers that it offersThe set of functions suits me, for the money. But touch screen control is difficult because the screen is small and not always sure about the accuracy of the selection. Instead, it would be better to have two additional buttons on the left for scrolling and highlight the selected shade.In such a competitive era. I dont expect such quality from Garmin. If we compare it to that of Sam active 2 that is more promisinhg and havubg good features.very pleased with the watch to date. Long battery life, great features and easy to operate.I received the watch yesterday and wore it all night last night and through the day today. The battery was at less than 30% less than 36 hours after I started wearing it. I charged it to 100% before I put it on and charged it tonight. I don’t want to have to charge it once a day.Integration with my 520 plus is good, but instructions could be more precise.  Video instruction for each section would be helpful (ie golf, bike, walk, run etc).pairing Videos would also help. I realise that some are available, but a more logical progression / order would be beneficial .Two days in and I really like the watch. 
Pros:  
Size and shape (square makes it easier to get a text message on the screen)
Screen colors look good.
Easy music set up and headphone pairing, took no time at all to get my Spotify playlist on the watch and headphones connected.

Cons:
Settings menu only available on watch itself.  Why can't this all be found on the phone app?
Battery is down to 40% after 1.5 days with 30 minutes of gps. (I have been tweeking settings and getting it set up so this may not be reflective of daily use)
Lack of watch faces, patience is hard. =D
Text size.  Can you please make this adjustable, my eyesight isn't getting better with age..I was looking for a watch to track sleep and SpO2 in addition to outdoor activities.  For sleep it had to be light and comfortable to wear to bed.  The Venu Sq is one of the lightest smartwatches I've worn and the silicon band is very comfortable so it's easy to sleep with.  It has a pretty simplified screen but has a lot of features.  The GPS performance is quite good and and for a MTB ride in valleys and trees it performs on par with the much larger Garmin fenix 6Pro.  Loading additional exercise modes, music and clockfaces isn't the easiest, but once it's set up everything works great.  For such a small and lite watch it is really packed with features.I've had Garmin Watches forever and was looking to upgrade to one with Music.
I love that I can now use my wireless earpods. I also love the square watch as opposed to the rounded ones, I previously owned.  BUT, I am very disappointed in the font size and the inability to increase it.  Even with my glasses, I find it hard to read the text messages.Every time I close Garmin Connect on an iphone, the phone disconnects.  My Garmin Instinct NEVER did this.  About to send the Venu SQ back.

name: Ghostbusters Stay Puft Marshmallow Man Inflatable Adult Costume
review: This costume says adult, but a child’s size came. There seems to be some glitch and the person at our local store said both description on the website (adult and child) list the same product number so he doesn’t think there is truly an adult one on the website. Needless to say my son was super disappointed and we almost didn’t get him one in time for Halloween this year.

name: Hasbro Marvel Legends Series Deadpool Collection Shiklah 6-in Action Figure

This figure is great but you guys should handle your packaging better.Great figure for a fairly unknown character. As most collectors focus on MCU known releases, it is good to still have a deep comic book connection.Better as a collectors item then to open it up right away.It's a nice figure for a char I have never heard of. Like the look and how they put it together.

name: Honey-Can-Do Floating Wall Shelf
review:
This shelf is attractive and decent quality but is way over priced for what it is.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Honey-Can-Do horizontal floating wall shelf is a I-Can-Do. It is so easy to assemble and install that I didn’t need help from anyone. The ledge is a decent depth and the shelf hangs securely in the wall. I would recommend this shelf for anyone who wants a little decorative shelf but is not the necessarily a DIYer.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This shelf is super cute and sturdy. It makes for a perfect bathroom shelf. The only thing I dont like is the shadowing from the top of the shelf, but not a huge issue. Either way it makes for a cute decoration.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Horizontal Floating Wall shelf gave my glam room the perfect update that I needed! It’s so simple, clean and sleek looking. I am able to display some of my favorite perfumes on this shelf. Assembly was a snap. The natural wood look makes it pop![This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shelf is well-made and attractive. I personally would prefer the wood shelf to be a little bit darker.

As far as functionality, it doesn’t have much. The frame is just there to add visual appeal, but you really can only use it for the shelf space, which is small. It’s almost like it’s more of a decorative element to have the frame around it and that requires a lot of hardware in the wall to keep it secure.

The directions are clear and it’s easy to install. It just took a little extra time because you’re using heavy duty bolts that go into the wall.

Personally, I don’t feel that the amount of work going into putting it in the wall and the holes you put in the wall are worth it for the small amount of storage and decoration that the product gives.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautiful wall shelf. I love the style of this shelf. It's simple but unique. It really does look like it's floating. It is very easy to install on the wall and feels very sturdy. I don't feel uncomfortable putting my breakable products on it. It is spacious enough for a few knick knacks, candles or even small plants. I highly recommend this shelf to anyone looking for a floating wall shelf that has a unique look.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received the Honey -can-do Horizontal Floating Shelf.   It was so easy to assemble, and it came with all the needed tools and screws to assemble and hang.  I love the color and the way it looks mounted on the wall.  I would definitely recommend this product.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This filled the little wall space I needed with added purpose! The shelf was a little smaller than I anticipated but is functional for holding some selected  office supplies. 
Easy to follow assembly instructions, come with all tools to complete, except wall mounting.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son has a smaller room, but we still fit a queen sized bed in it. That way he can't outgrow it, and it can be used for company. But, because we did that, we need space saving, but highly functional furniture pieces. We have a mail holder shelf on one side that fits his tablet, books, etc attached to the wall, this shelf is perfect for his cup and glasses. We had been searching for something like this. It is even modern, and built well, too! Style and function. My son absolutely loves it!. The only negative we could find was that we had to use our own anchors. The anchors included really did not fit the included screws. My husband is a master electrician and carpenter, so we had some on hand. We still give this shelf 5 stars, no doubt about it!. I received this to test, but all opinions are honest and my own.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love my Floating Wall Shelf. It was extremely easy to assemble and hang on my wall. It adds a pop in my decor and great just to have a shelf to decorate. I love the sophisticated look and how it adds an extra bit of style to my wall. It is extremely durable and very sturdy. I never thought of using something like this to decorate my walls, but creates a nice simple but sophisticated look to my room.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this shelf so I could have a special spot up high to put my wax warmer so the kids can't get to it.  It has a bit of a rustic look to it which I just love.  And the size is exactly what I needed without being too small or too big.  Over all I just love this shelf[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Horizontal Floating Wall Shelf is very sturdy and really nice. Easy to put together and easy to hang.[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Honey-Can-Do  Horizontal Floating Shelf is perfect for any small wall space where you are needing to add small decor. It was a breeze to put together and install. One person can easily put it together and add it in a pinch. I had been looking for a shelf for our guest bathroom and couldn’t find the “right” one after searching. As soon as it came I knew it was what I had been looking for. It goes perfectly and takes up minimal space. The color and quality of it is great. Highly recommend this floating shelf!

name: Hunting Simulator - PlayStation 4
review:
It was good from the beginning, gives you a overall feel of real life hunts. You gotta have patience and technique to understand this game. Was worth it, also might I add get the newer game as well.This game will test your patience as well as your eyesight. If you want a good hunting game, this is it.Worst game ever a reason why I gave it one Stars cuz I couldn't write a review without rating itMy 9yr old likes he said a little hard for his age but likes itThere is more to it than I thought. Takes some getting used to!Boring if u use the wrong caliber gun for the animal u lose pointsCould of had more gun companies to choose from but the game was goodit was very challenging but very good. had good quality. and it was very fun to play.This game is not what I thought it would be. Was looking for a little more realistic hunting experience.I got this game to see what it's like and I cant complain at all. I enjoy it alot and is fun to play.Pretty good. Graphics and realism suck a little but overall it’s fun.I bought this two weeks ago and still trying to get use to it.It’s a hunting game. There’s guns. There’s animals. That’s basically all you need to make it good. BUT your character can walk through huge bushes but gets blocked by dandelions. But at the end of the day, it’s a good hunting game.I've played better hunting games on mobile app... 
Was really upset pretty much across the board on everything.  From graphics to game playI am a hunter not a gamer but I do enjoy playing games on occasion. Have been playing a game I got at Game Stop called The Hunter Call Of The Wild & absolutely love it. Then I was told about The Hunting Simulator by a Game Stop employee & thought it would be great. It is not, graphics are very bad, everything is just bad. Very big mistake buying this game. Did not enjoy it at all. I gave it a one star because it would not let me give it a zero.Bought this a few days ago and it’s a waste of moneythe game is decent for the price and is good for people that want to learn about huntingThe game is not so great. I got is game and I don't like the game at all.played most of game so far no glitches and about as real as a video is going to get

name: Hyperkin Duke Wired Controller for Xbox One Green GameStop Exclusive
review:
Thought I was getting a GREEN controller, but turns out that BOTH "editions" show up with an image of the green controller. So while yes I should have been paying attention, it seems a little sketchy that you can't even take a picture of the black controller and set up the right picture for it? Also didn't have any emails from the company until it arrived. No order confirmation, nothing that would have let me see my error until I opened the box it came in.A perfect example of a classic staple and a must-have for any and all true OG Xbox fans/players.Great controller for those of us with BIG hands!  Hate the shoulder buttons...This broke less then 1 month after purchase. Analog sticks malfunctioned completely and do not work. I do not recommend purchasing this controller. It brings memories back of having original xbox controller. But in the end, that is all you have, memories.... with no controller!I do wish it were a pro controller with extra mappable trigger buttons but I do love this thing! I’ve got big hands so for me it’s quite comfortable. The second triggers are a bit oddly placed as well but very manageable to use. I also love the look!!! And the little screen on the controller. Way cool revamp of a thrown back legendary controller!Great for people with big hands. 
Button layout actually helps for fighting games imo. 
Super nostalgic with the og Xbox load screen. 
Only downside is that it’s not wireless.works great a little big so may not fit in everyone's hands. Has many awesome features from playing the Xbox start up animation upon hitting the home Butten to adding small bumpers for more convenient play.Had to return it a few times cuz the connecting part is fragile and disconnects midgame sometimes - didn't realize it was a duke made by a third party or 'hyperkin' - probably would've reconsidered since the quality is just not there.This thing brings back so many memories. It works perfectly and the LED screen built in that displays the original Xbox boot screen is an excellent touch.Fantastic quality. It is a perfect recreation of the classic Xbox controller (with some improvements) The triggers feel more modern, the thumb sticks are grippier, the shoulder buttons feel as good as they could. It's silly but the home button screen animation is very satisfying to watch every time you press the button. Even though I have small hands I really love this controller. I can't explain it. It's just comfortable.Even though I intentionally bought this as a collectors item, I had to use it acouple times to feel the nostalgia of original Xbox days?I have a bit bigger hands and having been molded from the original XBOX controller, which I loved for this reason, it fits very comfortably in my hands.  I love the color (I have a thing for green) and the light up parts are a nice touch.  I'm also quite fond of the little display in the middle that plays the original XBOX start up sequence.  I love this little beast.I love this remote. It's very responsive and it feels just like the old Xbox remote. I've played Shooting and Fighting games with it and aside from me getting used to the shift in buttons it I really enjoyed it.Awesome.feel. cant stoo using it over my wireless.The only thing they could improve is add wireless version. This is a almost perfect reproduction as the original duke. They really nailed the feel and how on some games it does take a while to get used to. The addition of the right and left bumpers actually helps out a lot. I kinda wish microsoft would let them use the wireless for this.Bumper buttons are to far apart from triggers makes for difficult gamingAbsolutely love the look and feel of this controller, do NOT like the cord being detachable and with it being plugged in my headset causes a buzzing feedback for any friends in my party.Started off as a novelty, but quickly became one of my favorite controllers. This infamous pad really has nice feel!This controller is not for everyone and not practical from most games, have found some usefulness in a few titles due to the black and white buttons which replicate the left and right bumpers, which are not very ergonomic in their placement. Nonetheless a great replica. As a fan of the original, it’s a great nostalgia piece.Not good at all very weak control for the price they askingIt was a bit bulky and uncomfortable at first but I got used to it. It works well and controls smoothly.Great throw back to the legend know as the Duke! Very well made and durable. I plan on getting every color!A great controller, exactly how I remember it. A little a too big for my hands, but that’s part of the nostalgia. The screen is a nice touch and I find myself watching it anytime I press it.Excellent controller. Long USB cord. Quality is very high in materials used. Just like the original controller. Love it.Very good controller. Not receiving for people with small handsThis does exactly what I wanted and more! The extra bumper buttons take some getting used to but so do having B & W buttons again. 
The main negatives are the lower analog sensitivity and being not truly wired, but not wireless either.if they had a black colored that would be even better.This is the best original controller for Xbox one!It feels and plays just like an original one, and the lcd start up screen is awsome.
Only drawback is it is not wireless, but the cord that comes with it is pretty long.The size is great for my large hands! Required me to adjust my playing a bit. The bumper buttons placement is different than other controllers I've used.My brother and I have used this controller relentlessly. And apart from odd bumper placement, this controller is like being a 6 year old again playing Halo Combat Evolved.So I got this thing both because of my large hands, and because of nostalgia. But I've only used it about once. First and foremost, the wire it comes with is super low-quality, and it will disconnect for literally no reason. I'd recommend using- or purchasing- a PS4 controller charging cord, as those work really well on this. I would also recommend not using a headset, especially a stereo headset, with the controller. When my controller became disconnected, and I'd re-attach the cord, my headset would almost always emit a horrifying screeching sound, or loud static. Not joking there, the xbox party I was in at the time could also hear it. Other than the horrifying noises from that, the thing works pretty well.Best controller ever. Brings back lots of memories of playing the original Xbox systemI bought this today because I felt nostalgic. Idk its because Im more comfortable with the xbox one controllers of today but playing with this controller is hard. If they would have the LB and RB bumpers bigger I can maybe get use to it.The only thing cool on here is the light up thing in the middle. I dont know how I played with the original controller back in the day. If youre a big fan of the controller then buy it.I love the feel when I'm going retro and playing original xbox games but with seamless transition to modern xbox games as well. My only gripe is the LCD screen has so much potential to only play the retro logo and login just seams like a waste of ground breaking potential.Hyperkin has done Xbox Gamers everywhere a great service, by bringing back "The Duke." This is a real two-fisted controller that just feels right in your hands. Black or transparent Green (I have both), you can't go wrong with "The Duke."The Duke feels surprisingly good in your hands after all this time, although it's big enough it can be a little chunky for extended play.  The LCD boot up screen is a fantastic touch.  The only issue I have with the controller is one that was fixed for this very reason: the black and white buttons are very awkward and impractical to use.  They have been supplemented with small, square buttons where the LB and RB bumpers would normally be, which is a nice addition, but they're not as handy, ergonomic, or responsive as the true bumpers are on a regular controller.great the only thing I would have changed was made it wireless. Other then that I love it.Got big hands? Or just in love with nostalgia, this controller is the one for you!!I was going to get a an after glow initially for my pc saw this beauty and remembered the promo about it and I was taken back with nostalgia and its so great using the of Xbox controller on my modern pc it's a fantastic controller definitely recommend this one.I really love this controller, but was honestly upset that a “new” one had the factory seals broken and taken out of the box all for display purposes. I don’t see any reason for this as they had security locks that could have kept the controller from being stolen without physically taking it out of the box. Just because they say it’s new how do I know someone hadn’t used it.I bought this a week or so ago and I couldn’t be happier. Loved these controllers when they were the latest and greatest with Xbox original. Playing Halo now feels like old times!!Bought this because i loved the controllor on the original xbox this feels the same and yet betterI bought this not to long ago just cause of the nostalgia and I needed another controller but I didn’t really expect me to be using it all the time. But I am. I haven’t used my normal controller ever since I got this. It’s so comfortable in my big manly man hands even tho I don’t really have manly hands. They’re just big. Like this controller. But all that aside it’s amazing it works perfectly and I love how they added bumpers. Some say they’re cheaply made but I think they’re great.This is my favorite version of the duke controller! I have 2 black ones and thought this version was only limited to the people that developed it!Few weeks ago I saw it and forgot it released so I picked it up and didn’t regret it. Looks amazing and the grip and controls are just perfect. Reminds me so much of the old days.I looooove this controller. Granted, I might be biased, as this is my favorite controller of all time. This recreation is so great. I especially love that the black and white buttons are still here, and they are extra buttons for functions.Pros: 

Nostalgia 

COMFORTABLE 

Functionality 

Durability 

Xbox Logo LCD is AWESOME 

Cons: 

Not wireless 

Not for people with small hands 

Left and right bumpers might be a bit to far for some serious fps gamers. 

 

I was using a Razer Wolverine Ultimate (same shaped and design as Xbox One controller) before this one and let me say just how good this controller feels in my hands in comparison. The Razer was giving me a really bad palm blister. As a gamer knows we can play for several hours at a time and I feel I can play with this controller for hours with zero discomfort. The left and right stick are very springy, responsive and have a sense of resistance unlike most third party hardware producers that make thumb sticks feel weak. They have a grip textured feel to them that feel amazing. The way the dpad feels might not be for everyone but I love how squishy it feels. When you hit the home button it plays the original xbox boot screen and I cant people enough about how freaking awesome it is. I highly recommend this controller to anyone who is experiencing discomfort with their current controller or anyone who is looking for a good hit of nostalgia. I am very happy with this purchase. Now all I need is a good carrying case for it.I just received my green Duke controller today. My first game loaded up was Halo: Combat Anniversary. Ahhh, the memories! This is how this game was meant to be played if you have big hands. I love it and highly recommend it!

name: I Need My Space Astronaut Word Art Mens Hooded Sweatshirt
review:
Great sweatshirt! Inside is very comfortable as well as the outside. I'm pretty picky with long sleeve cuffs and this sweatshirt nailed it with the size, not too large, not to small with the perfect give that will still allow the shirt to hold onto my arms when pulled up and fit nice and snug when pulled down. Bottom hem also fits great and is not too saggy with plenty of give. Print is great and centered perfectly and is barley noticeable when touched. Drawstrings have a metal ring so the sweatshirt material shouldn't rip with wear. Sweatshirt is not too thick but also not too thin. Hood is also a great fit. I'd say this is a top notch quality sweatshirt that didn't miss on the quality details that make a long lasting clothing item.  
  
Just waiting to see all the planets, especially the moon.

name: Injustice: Gods Among Us Ultimate Edition - Xbox 360
review: This is a good fighter with a balanced combat system.  If you feel like Mortal Kombat is too gory for your kids, this is a great alternative.Great game with all the DLC. Love injustice a must buy.Good purchase, great gameplay, tricky controls as firstIt's like any other fighting game, just with dc characters.First time player, great game with good graphics and player selection.Anoher replacement game, love to play the multi player feature online and with familyHas a learning curve, but doesn't stop it from being fun and addictive.I loved this game back when I had an Xbox 360. I sold it when I upgraded to an Xbox One not realizing it was backwards compatible. I just bought it again. I was addicted to Injustice 2, but wanted this one so I could play as Nightwing. Still fun!Not gonna lie, I'm no good at these games but it's still pretty awesome!I purchased this for my son & it never worked. I even tried it on another xbox. I would think you would check these games before selling, very unhappy!!Love the game..own 2nd version..wanted first version to play tooit was the worst game in my entire life and the graphics didn't look to realInjustice Gods Among Us is from the people who bought everyone the one and only, Mortal Kombat series. this game is a lot like Mortal Kombat only with DC superheroes and villain's. every fighter is great in the game; it only depends who you like. the story mode is very deep, and exciting. plus the extra content is a bonus for the ultimate edition. overall great fighting game.I was going to buy the basic game, but took a chance and went for the Ultimate Edition. Really glad I did. The extra added characters and features makes it well worth the little extra. So many skill levels will entertain new players and old die hard fighter fans alike. Always great playing the DC heroes and the Baddies too. would recommend to anyone, thinking of buying the basic. You won't be sorry.I think it's a perfect game I love it and the best part is that the are making a second one on xbox one. One thing I think should be upgrade is the moves the should put a lot more power moves and stuff.Hope the second game is just as good.All in all not a bad game, tho is does have it's minor cons and let downs but like i said all in all not bad. Deff worth every penny.This game while very disappointing, is a very good game for new players to fighters. The game overall is a very fun game with a well balanced lineup of characters.3 words. best graphics ever.if this was a shooter game it would notbe argued about with battlefield fans and COD fans. Besides, the fact that the regular game has awesome characters, really really awesome including 6 new characters! awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! and i would slightly violent i would not recommend for 7 to 9 year olds. but seriously. the fact that you can pla on mobile devices is awesome. INJUSTICE: GODS AMONG US Regular Edition is awesome 3 on 3 combatics is awesome. darkseid is awesome superman is awesome BATMAN IS AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! would totally recommend.This game was awesome I love it. It's so exciting to fight against villains and superheroes. My xbox 360 broke so I'm getting an xbox one. Hope it runs smooth on the new systemWow...that is all I can say. Forget about eating, sleeping and cleaning the gutters because this is all you will be doing for, like, ever. You can be Super Heroes and stuff and also the bogus bad guys that try and cramp their style. Oh, and there are like, locations from the comics that you fight in and stuff. Scorpion from Mortal Kombat is along for the ride too because it's freaking Scorpion. If you liked Hello Kitty's Island Adventure you will absolutely LOVE this freaking game. Grilled Cheese is a good lunch.AWESOME !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Injustice gods among us is a good but not great game, however there is a Scropian DlC so it kind of makes me want to pick it as I've only played the demo.People who love street fight, tekkan, & Mortal Combat I would highly suggest at least taking a look at the gameI think it was an awesome idea for this game but some characters i think could have been better like bane could have been the newest bane or for a DLC most people like the dark night rises bane but they could have added different characters like killer croc, beast boy,or something like that but the original copy was a great game i never played this copy but from what I've played the game is awesome and i think nether realm and DC should keep working togetherThis is one of those games where we wait for it to come out and it meets our standards at most points. It has good graphics great voice acting the action can be amazing at times and lackluster at others, in my opinion it gets pretty repetative during the 4 hour story mode and the star lab missions can be downright frustrating at times with no real incentive to keep at them. Multiplayer is where this game shines it is great fun to take on your friends andd settle those lifelong debates like wwho would win between batman and aquaman. all in all this is a good game but had just a few issues that kept it from being greatI have this game before in xbox 360, but right now I have I xbox one and this game is only for xbox 360, ps3,ps4. please make this game to xbox one. I know there are people who like this game. hardcore gamers! thanks.First off I loved Injustice and traded my copy in to buy the Ultimate Edition. I would recommend this edition over the original because you will receive all the DLC that's available for the game. However being a DC Comics fan for a majority of my life, I have to wonder why they used Batgirl and General Zod. Quite honestly, Batgirl and Batman are basically the same except for genders and Superman and General Zod are basically they same so why use them instead of adding something new and fresh like Swamp Thing or even Killer Croc (even though I hate how many batman characters were put into this game). The skins are incredible and were used from multiple different storylines throughout the DC Universe such as Blackest and DC's new 52. The campaign was good (people who don't know the storyline would say incredible) and was entertaining. The campaign lasts around 5-6 hours but for a fighting game that's not too bad. Im hoping more future superhero fighting games are created like this. I would highly recommend to all fighting game fans or superhero fans

name: JVC Dynamic Sound High-Grade Full-Size Headphones
review:
Excellent wired headphones - excellent frequency response. Impedence is high, so it's best to use with a headphone amp if possible, but still good for use with portable devices at moderate volumes.

Note the model is HA-RX900

name: Ja-Ru Squish Attack Squooshy Sphere Glow Assortment
review: My daughter squished it less than a minute and it popped.Unfortunately we bought one with a rip in it. Sticky stuff comes of it. It still has its shape but my son can't play with it so it just sits there. It glows though.the first one i purchased for my child started leaking foam before we left the parking lot. And made a mess on my leather seats.  So, I returned it and exchanged it for a more expensive version. But this larger and more expensive version also started seeping out the next day.  Because i didn't know what  this substances consisted of I made my child leave it out side on the patio. By the next morning it had all leaked out. I have it to return when I am near the store again.
